https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2002047^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2002047"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"ALIVE - A National Research Translation Centre to implement Mental Health Care at Scale
column2: Special Initiative"^"ALIVE is a national research translation Centre to implement mental health care at scale. Our vision is to reduce the individual
column3: social and economic impacts of mental illness burden and health inequities by transforming the primary care and community settings to: 1) embed novel preventive life course models; 2) implement mental-physical health tailored models of care with priority populations; 3) be informed by lived-experience models and leadership."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007001^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007001"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Revolution of sleep diagnostics and personalized health care based on digital diagnostics and therapeutics with health data integration
column2: International Collaborations"^"Almost 1 billion people suffer from sleep apnoea. Unfortunately
column3: the current diagnostic metric relates poorly to the symptoms and comorbidities of sleep apnoea merely measuring the frequency of breathing cessations. We aim to develop machine learning techniques to better estimate sleep apnoea severity. These techniques are implemented to high-end wearables developed in this project. Finally
column4: we aim to design a digital diagnostic platform and create new standardised guidelines for sleep medicine."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007006^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007006"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"DigiCare4You - An intersectoral innovative solution involving DIGItal tools
column2: empowering families and integrating community CARE services for the prevention and management of type 2 diabetes and hypertension
column3: International Collaborations"^"The overall aim of the research is to design and implement an innovative intervention that will bring together the available community-care infrastructure
column4: human resources and services
column5: as well as technological advancements on digital health
column6: for the early prevention and treatment of type 2 diabetes and hypertension. The active involvement of Australian researchers in this international collaboration ensures that this innovation and its benefits will be transferred to Australia in the future."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007014^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007014"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Intelligent total body scanner for early detection of melanoma
column2: International Collaborations"^"Melanoma is the 4th most common cancer in Australia; the main screening tool is a time-consuming total body examination with a hand-held dermoscope. This project aims to develop a total body scanner using fast-refocusing lenses to take total body dermoscopy images of all skin lesions in approximately 6 minutes
column3: integrated with a computer aided diagnostic tool providing a risk score for each lesion incorporating medical history
column4: genotypic and phenotypic risk markers."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007048^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007048"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"ManagemenT of chronIc cardioMetabolic diseasE and treatment diScontinuity in adult ADHD PAtieNts (TIMESPAN)
column2: International Collaborations"^"The aim of TIMESPAN is to improve the management of patients with Attention Deficit Hyperactivity Disorders (ADHD) and co-occurring cardiometabolic disease (i.e. obesity
column3: type-2 diabetes
column4: and cardiovascular disease). Inadequate treatment of these common conditions can lead to premature death and substantial societal costs. We will use linked electronic health records and novel research methods to improve clinical outcomes and quality of life of adults with ADHD and cardiometabolic disease."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007059^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007059"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Re-imagining Environments for Connection and Engagement: Testing Actions for Social Prescribing in Natural Spaces
column2: International Collaborations"^"This project will evaluate whether and how nature-based social prescribing (NBSP) can address mental well-being. We will experimentally test the effectiveness of NBSP in promoting connection among populations experiencing social isolation and loneliness with socially oriented opportunities in safe
column3: inclusive and accessible
column4: green and blue outdoor urban spaces. The project will build the evidence base for the value of NBSP investments in improving mental health."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2002381^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2002381"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Parenting+ Improving health and service-use outcomes through health literacy training for new parents: an effectiveness-implementation hybrid trial
column2: Partnership Projects"^"The Parenting+ project will evaluate an educational program for socio-economically and culturally diverse new parents. The study will assess the impact of the program on parents' health literacy
column3: parent and infant health and psychosocial outcomes and health service use over one year. It additionally will identify key characteristics and reproducible steps in the successful implementation of the program in order to support wider adoption by other health services."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2002625^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2002625"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Enhancing behavioural surveillance to address gaps and disparities in Australia's HIV response in a changing HIV epidemic
column2: Partnership Projects"^"This project will test and evaluate changes to Australia's HIV behavioural surveillance system
column3: increasing recruitment and data collection from overseas-born
column4: bisexual and heterosexual men who have sex with men (MSM). This is necessary because Australia's HIV epidemic is changing
column5: with falling infections among Australian-born gay men
column6: but rising infections in other groups
column7: such as Asian-born MSM. The project will use technological advancements in recruitment
column8: survey research and interviews."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2003399^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2003399"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Novel strategies for improving syphilis testing and control
column2: Partnership Projects"^"Syphilis has been resurgent in many countries including Australia. Our research will evaluate novel strategies to improve syphilis testing
column3: surveillance
column4: and control and ensure these new strategies are effective at targeting affected groups attending health services. The research findings will help guide better syphilis testing and control by health care providers
column5: pathology services and health policy makers."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2005191^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2005191"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Defining and optimising the economic and social return on investment of telephone cancer information and support services for all Australians
column2: Partnership Projects"^"The economic and social value of telephone cancer information and support services (CISS) for Australia is undefined thus hindering decisions about the future direction of services and levels of funding. This research will identify and compare the broad monetised
column3: social benefits of CISS with the costs of providing the service. We will identify different strategies to deliver
column4: promote and target services to improve cancer outcomes for all Australians and maximise the return on investment."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2005403^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2005403"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving the safety and quality of emergency nursing care
column2: Partnership Projects"^"Failure to assess
column3: treat comprehensively and escalate emergency patient care can be catastrophic. However
column4: there is no emergency nursing framework in use for the 29
column5: 000+ emergency nurses working in Australia. We aim to improve access
column6: consistency
column7: safety and quality of emergency care for the best possible patient outcomes through system wide implementation of HIRAID - the only validated framework designed to teach emergency nurses how to systematically assess and manage emergency patients."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2005589^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2005589"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"I-HEART - Implementation of HEArt failure guidelines in Regional AusTralia
column2: Partnership Projects"^"Heart failure (HF) is a common disease of the heart with a high rehospitalisation and mortality rate. Regional HF patients rarely receive the full benefits of evidence-based care simply due to inaccessibility to a HF specialist team. This translational project will implement key recommendations from clinical guidelines in regional health services and improve access to specialist services. It has the potential to keep patients out of hospital and save lives."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2005759^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2005759"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving interpreting for dementia assessments: The MINDSET Study
column2: Partnership Projects"^"The MINDSET Study aims to improve the quality of communication in an interpreter mediated cognitive assessment for dementia. Working with interpreters
column3: clinicians
column4: culturally and linguistically diverse people with dementia
column5: and their carers we will co-design
column6: trial
column7: and implement national online training targeted at interpreters. This training will enable interpreters to be prepared and confident in performing their role impartially
column8: effectively

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2005779^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2005779"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving the management of Obstructive Sleep Apnea and Insomnia in General Practice
column2: Partnership Projects"^"The two most common clinical sleep disorders
column3: insomnia and obstructive sleep apnea (OSA)
column4: affect >4 million Australians
column5: costing Australia over $66 billion annually. People with sleep disorders are receiving care that is far from best practice and is potentially dangerous. This novel partnership study represents a major step towards improving management of sleep disorders in primary care (PC) using new
column6: evidence-based
column7: models of care for insomnia and OSA
column8: designed specifically for PC."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2005790^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2005790"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Partnership for Precision Prevention in CAD (PPP-CAD)
column2: Partnership Projects"^"There is an urgent need for new tools to improve risk prediction for coronary artery disease which accounts for one fifth of deaths in Australia. Polygenic risk scores that incorporate the information from millions of genetic variants have shown great promise
column3: but need prospective evaluation. Our team of clinical
column4: research
column5: industry and government leaders will develop clinical pathways and implement polygenic risk scores in primary care to improve precision of preventative strategies."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2005797^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2005797"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The Personalising Acute Myocardial Infarction Care to improve Outcomes (PAMICO Project)
column2: Partnership Projects"^"The modern management of heart attacks has improved survival dramatically
column3: however
column4: not all patients receive the best care available
column5: leading to variation in quality and health outcomes. The PAMICO Project (Personalising Acute Myocardial Infarction Care to improve Outcomes) aims to bridge this gap using sophisticated electronic data systems and integrated care teams to produce personalised clinical management pathways so that care is patient-centered and aligned with best practice."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006408^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006408"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Steroid-Reducing Options for ReLapsING PMR (STERLING-PMR): a pragmatic
column2: randomised trial to compare the clinical and cost-effectiveness of adding immunosuppression to steroid-tapering treatment for patients with relapsing PMR
column3: versus steroid-tapering
column4: International Collaborations"^"Polymyalgia rheumatica (PMR) is a common inflammatory disease of older people
column5: treated with prednisolone (steroid tablet). About 50% will relapse and often suffer from steroid side effects (eg diabetes
column6: bone fracture). This study will determine whether an extra treatment can reduce prednisolone use in people with relapsing PMR; and improve quality of life. The study will include participants in UK and Australia and provide a unique opportunity for further research in this under-researched area."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007142^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007142"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The Meniscal Transplant surgery or Optimised Rehabilitation full randomised trial (MeTeOR2)
column2: International Collaborations"^"It can be hard to decide what treatment to use for people with pain and disability who have had the meniscus cartilage removed from the knee. Some surgeons try to improve pain and function by replacing the lost meniscus with a transplant from a donor who has died. The alternatives include exercises
column3: physiotherapy
column4: and bracing. This study will help us understand if the results for people who have the transplant are better or worse than for exercise and physiotherapy."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2005944^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2005944"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"National First Nations Research Network
column2: National Network for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander health researchers"^"The National First Nations Research Network will mark a transformation in First Peoples livelihoods and Health Equity. Delivered and led by Indigenous Peoples for Indigenous Peoples
column3: guided by self-determination
column4: this Network will nurture culturally safe environments
column5: connect expertise
column6: catalyse research methods
column7: training and development. The Network will create career pathways to achieve national capability and generational growth
column8: for sustained health and wellbeing of our communities."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006719^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006719"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Emerging techniques for earlier diagnosis and assessment of severity and progression of artificial stone silicosis
column2: Targeted Call for Research"^"Stonemasons who have worked with engineered stone have been shown to develop a rapidly progressive and potentially fatal form of silicosis. This research will use data from affected workers from Victoria
column3: Western Australia and Queensland. The research will comprise a suite of projects to investigate many uncertainties related to radiological screening methods
column4: as well as investigating new methods to assess disease severity and identify indicators of progression to inform future practice."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009196^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009196"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"HPV-based testing and treatment for the elimination of cervical cancer in Papua New Guinea (HPVTATE)
column2: International Collaborations"^"Building on the innovative cervical screening model that we successfully designed and delivered in partnership with provincial health authorities in urban primary care settings in PNG
column3: the overarching aim of the proposed study is to determine the reach
column4: effectiveness
column5: cost-effectiveness
column6: acceptability and scalability of HPV-based testing and treatment for the elimination of cervical cancer (HPVTATE) among women in rural and remote communities in Papua New Guinea."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009206^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009206"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"SISTAQUIT scale-up in Indigenous populations in Australia
column2: International Collaborations"^"SISTAQUITÂ®(Supporting Indigenous Smokers to Assist Quitting) is a research backed training program that provides free
column3: online training in quit smoking methods to health providers. This study aims to expand the SISTAQUIT intervention to all Australian health services that cater to Indigenous women during pregnancy. This research will test numerous methods to implement SISTAQUIT to identify the most effective and economical strategy suitable for roll-out
column4: and build Indigenous workforce capacity."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009317^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009317"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Developing a scalable
column2: woman-centred model for cervical cancer screening in vulnerable women in India
column3: International Collaborations"^"Cervical cancer is a devastating but preventable disease and 1 in 5 cases of cervical cancer in the world occur in India. We will work with women
column4: communities
column5: and health services in two States of India (Tamil Nadu and Mizoram) to design a woman friendly approach to prevent cervical cancer. This project brings together international and Indian experts to overcome current barriers to cervical screening by using a newer
column6: more effective way of screening to reach underserved women and save lives."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2010271^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2010271"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Developing and testing a community-informed intervention to increase VIA cervical cancer screening in Eswatini
column2: International Collaborations"^"Eswatini has the highest rate of cervical cancer in the world. Cervical cancer screening is effective at reducing deaths from this disease. However
column3: in Eswatini rates of cervical screening are very low
column4: with one study estimating that only 5% of women had ever undergone screening. This project will explore barriers to cervical screening in Eswatini
column5: and develop and test culturally appropriate strategies to improve participation in cervical screening."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2000344^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2000344"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Pragmatic trial of a targeted digital intervention for youth with suicidal thoughts and behaviours attending outpatient care
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"Existing programs aiming to reduce suicide ideation in youth often fail to impart lasting benefits in helping young people stay well. Our team have developed an online social media-based intervention (called Affinity) that addresses limitations of past programs by allowing 24/7 access to digital therapy
column3: alongside therapist and peer support. This trial will aim to uncover whether Affinity is effective in reducing suicide ideation in young people
column4: relative to a control program."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2000375^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2000375"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A Phase III randomised placebo-controlled trial of mirtazapine as a pharmacotherapy for methamphetamine ("Ice") dependence
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"Crystalline methamphetamine ('ice') is a growing concern in Australia. There are no approved medications that can be used to treat dependence on this drug. This clinical trial will examine whether mirtazapine
column3: a newly identified treatment agent for methamphetamine use
column4: can be used safely and effectively in routine clinical care to manage methamphetamine dependence in Australia."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2000376^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2000376"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Breathing Control as a treatment for Non-Epileptic Seizures
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"Non-epileptic Seizures (NES) are fits that look like epilepsy but are not
column3: and are instead thought to be a psychological response to problems. Treating them psychologically is difficult
column4: however
column5: and doesn't usually work. We have discovered that patients' fits involve hyperventilation
column6: like a panic attack
column7: and can be stopped by teaching them to control their breathing in a similar way. In this study we aim to prove this
column8: by completing a trial of breath control training in NES."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2000404^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2000404"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Providing translatable evidence to advance prevention and management of COPD: a longitudinal study from the 1st to 7th decade of life
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"Chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD) makes breathing difficult and reduces wellbeing. People are more likely to get COPD from the age of 60 years
column3: but we do not know why and who. Our study will develop tools to identify early who will develop COPD by 60 years. We will also develop a tool to identify 60-year-old individuals whose lung function is declining faster than normal. These findings will help us to better prevent and manage COPD."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2000540^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2000540"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"PRogrEssion of DIabetic ComplicaTions - PREDICT
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"The PREDICT study will fill a very important gap in our understanding of diabetes. By studying what happens to over 3
column3: 000 people with type 2 diabetes over the next decade
column4: it will identify improved ways of identifying which people with diabetes will develop its devastating complications. This will allow targeting of intensive treatment on those who need it the most
column5: and will also provide an important means of identifying potential new ways of treating and supporting people with type 2 diabetes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2000711^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2000711"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"AGITG TOP GEAR: A randomised phase II/III trial of preoperative chemoradiotherapy versus preoperative chemotherapy for resectable gastric cancer
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"While surgery to remove stomach cancer has been traditionally accepted as the only way to potentially cure the disease
column3: there have been several recent advances using chemotherapy and/or radiotherapy both before and after surgery. Doctors' opinions remain divided regarding best treatments to give and in what order. This trial will address the important question of whether combined chemotherapy plus radiotherapy is more effective than chemotherapy alone in improving cure rates for stomach cancer."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2000780^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2000780"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Intermittent preventive treatment in pregnancy with sulphadoxine-pyrimethamine plus dihydroartemisinin-piperaquine to reduce adverse pregnancy outcomes and prevent malaria in Papua New Guinea: a randomised controlled trial
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"Millions of pregnancies are complicated by malaria worldwide. Monthly sulphadoxine-pyrimethamine (SP) treatments
column3: the current treatment strategy
column4: no longer protects from malaria but improves birth outcomes through non-malarial effects. Dihydroartemisinin-piperaquine clears malaria but babies are smaller compared to women who received SP. A clinical trial of their combination has potential to substantially improve health outcomes for women and babies in Papua New Guinea and beyond."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2000842^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2000842"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Uncovering the hidden impacts and costs of exposure to intimate partner violence in childhood: a 20-year cohort study
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"Intimate partner violence (IPV) and adverse childhood experiences are common
column3: and cluster within families. This longitudinal study will improve understanding of intergenerational impacts and costs of IPV and provide evidence regarding strategies that may reduce the risk of poor mental health in adult life for the more than 1 in 3 Australian children growing up in households where IPV is occurring."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2000989^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2000989"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"IMPLORE - Implementing an opioid stewardship intervention to reduce opioid use
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"Back pain is the leading cause for opioid use globally. Guidelines actively discourage opioid use for this condition but unfortunately it commonly ends up managed with opioid medicines. Urgent efforts are needed to reduce the burden of harm associated with excessive prescribing of opioids for back pain. This trial will evaluate a clinical care model that is grounded in research
column3: and designed to curb opioid analgesic use and achieve better health outcomes for people with back pain."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2001237^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2001237"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Low OxyGen Intervention for Cardiac Arrest injury Limitation trial (LOGICAL)
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"Life support with mechanical ventilation (MV) is required for most patients after cardiac arrest. Delivery of liberal oxygen therapy to patients receiving MV is standard care and exposes them to a high oxygen dose and higher blood oxygen levels. A higher amount of oxygen might be harmful after cardiac arrest
column3: but the optimal oxygen therapy in these patients is uncertain. This study tests standard care versus a protective conservative dose of oxygen on neurological recovery after cardiac arrest."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2001264^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2001264"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Reducing household air pollution exposure to improve early child health and development; extending the intervention and follow-up of "Poriborton: the CHANge trial".
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"Around the world each year household air pollution causes 4.3 million deaths. Mothers
column3: babies and children
column4: who spend the most time at home are extremely vulnerable. We will study the health of infants who have had reduced exposure in their first critical years of life and compare them to infants whose exposure was not reduced. This will provide compelling evidence for governments around the world of the need to assist families in developing settings to adopt clean energy."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2001375^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2001375"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A randomised controlled trial of N-acetylcysteine for the treatment of alcohol use disorder
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"We urgently require new treatment strategies. Alcohol misuse is a leading cause of preventable death yet treatment options are limited. We will undertake the first human trial of N-acetylcysteine (NAC) for the management of alcohol use disorder (NAC-AUD). The NAC-AUD project will evaluate the efficacy and cost-efficacy of NAC to reduce alcohol consumption. The results will generate high level clinical evidence for a safe new treatment for a common life threatening disease."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2001391^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2001391"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Cognitive Improvement through early Restoration of cirCADian rhythms in very preterm Infants via Environmental Modification: The CIRCA DIEM Study
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"When very premature infants are born
column3: they no longer receive important signals from their mother about whether it is daytime or night-time
column4: and are cared for in hospital environments that are noisy and brightly lit all day. The absence of the maternal signals and the constant light and noise may interfere with normal brain development. We will determine if wearing eye masks and ear muffs at night in hospital will improve brain development and general health in premature babies."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2001517^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2001517"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Reconceiving early detection of melanoma
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"Treatment for skin cancer costs the Australian healthcare system >$1 billion annually. Early detection and accurate diagnosis of melanoma improves survival
column3: however a standardised approach to diagnosis does not currently exist. This study will prospectively recruit 15
column4: 000 patients to develop and validate a risk stratified image-based approach to melanoma prevention
column5: early detection and surveillance which will incorporate cutting edge technologies to standardise diagnosis and optimise care."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2001568^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2001568"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A large-scale clinical effectiveness (health services) trial to determine whether personalised health care packages
column2: combined with digitally-supported measurement-based care
column3: improve functional outcomes in young people with mood disorders
column4: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"One of our greatest current health challenges is to develop highly-personalised interventions for teenagers and young adults with emerging mood disorders. This research will combine our national expertise to develop and implement care packages utilising digital technologies
column5: personalised assessment techniques
column6: targeted treatment choices
column7: and long-term outcome tracking. In a clinical trial we will assess the clinical effectiveness of these innovative healthcare packages."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2001578^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2001578"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Australasian Malignant Pleural Effusion (AMPLE)-3 trial
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"Cancers can spread to the lung causing fluid build-up and requires drainages in hospital that are painful and costly. Surgery is previously seen as the definitive option to stop fluid forming
column3: but is invasive with complications. Indwelling pleural catheter (IPC) is a novel implanted device inside the chest that allows patients to drain fluid at home. AMPLE Trial-3 is the first multicenter randomized clinical trial to compare surgery vs IPC to provide fluid control and improve quality of life."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2001751^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2001751"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"'Azithromycin before Birth'- Single dose azithromycin shortly before birth to reduce infection in Aboriginal mothers and babies: a randomised controlled trial.
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"Aboriginal mothers and babies in the Northern Territory have high rates of infection. A single dose of azithromycin given during labour (or prior to caesarean section) may reduce the rates of subsequent bacterial infection. This pragmatic clinical trial ('Azithromycin before Birth') will assess a simple intervention that has the potential to substantially improve health outcomes for women and babies at risk of new bacterial infection after birth."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2001834^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2001834"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A Scalable Insomnia Program during the Pregnancy and Postpartum Periods: An Effectiveness-Implementation Hybrid Trial
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"Persistent sleep problems are common during pregnancy/postpartum periods and have significant consequences. Cognitive behavioural interventions are efficacious for improving sleep but are not currently available in perinatal care. This study examines the effectiveness
column3: cost- effectiveness
column4: and implementation potential of an innovative nonpharmacological intervention for better maternal sleep and wellbeing
column5: with high potential for sustainable integration with routine perinatal care."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006101^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006101"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Prospective Ovarian Cancer Cohort to Authenticate Stratification of Prognosis in Ovarian Tumours (POCCA-SPOT)
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"Ovarian cancer has poor survival
column3: with less than 40% of women surviving 5 years. There is a wide range of survival
column4: but very few characteristics that indicate which patients will do well or poorly. We have developed a tumour test at diagnosis
column5: that can predict prognosis at 5 years. In newly diagnosed cases
column6: we will test tumours to predict prognosis and then determine the accuracy and assess patient acceptability. This study will lead to clinical use of the test and improve treatment decisions."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006403^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006403"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"INTERCEPT (Investigating Novel Therapy to target Early Relapse and Clonal Evolution as Pre-emptive Therapy in AML): a multi-arm
column2: precision-based
column3: recursive
column4: platform trial
column5: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"Acute myeloid leukemia is a rare and lethal blood cancer with limitless potential to evolve resistance. New technologies allow early detection of molecular 'fingerprints' of returning disease. We propose an international research team to conduct a multi-arm
column6: precision-based platform trial aimed at increasing and extending the duration of patient response and survival using novel combination options. INTERCEPT will suppress and eradicate relapse before the patient becomes clinically unwell."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006415^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006415"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Anti-PD 1 Brain Collaboration + Radiotherapy Extension: The ABC-X Study
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"The purpose of this research study is to determine whether administering radiotherapy to melanoma brain tumours
column3: in combination with 2 drugs called nivolumab and ipilimumab(also known as Immunotherapy)
column4: will be more effective than treating brain tumours with immunotherapy. Patients in this trial will be randomly assigned to 1 of 2 treatment groups. Group 1 will receive radiotherapy to their melanoma brain lesion(s)
column5: combined with immunotherapy. Group 2 will receive immunotherapy treatment alone."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006451^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006451"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Preventing infections in patients with blood cancer through evidence-based use of immunoglobulin or alternatives: The RATIONALISE trial
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"Patients with blood cancers
column3: with immune deficiency from low antibody levels and other disease or treatment factors
column4: are at risk of life-threatening infection. Immunoglobulins (Ig) made from plasma can supplement antibody levels. Government criteria recommend stopping Ig therapy in stable patients
column5: but with no evidence for when or how to do so. RATIONALISE will provide this evidence
column6: to improve patient outcomes
column7: reduce risks and costs
column8: and make better use of blood products for the community."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006491^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006491"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Whole-of-population CRISPR point-of-care testing for congenital cytomegalovirus to prevent hearing and neurodevelopment disabilities through a public health approach
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"Congenital cytomegalovirus infection (cCMV) is the major infective cause of deafness and brain disability
column3: both of which are potentially reversible with early treatment. Currently
column4: there is no screening at birth
column5: and cCMV is diagnosed too late for treatment. Our team will test and validate CRISPR
column6: a new and cheap technology
column7: on 110
column8: 000+ newborns to detect cCMV. This will revolutionise how cCMV is detected
column9: make treatment more accessible and pave way to lower rates of deafness and cerebral palsy."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006529^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006529"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Trans20: A longitudinal cohort study to improve outcomes for transgender children and adolescents
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"1% of young people now identify as transgender or gender diverse (TGD)
column3: and increasing numbers are presenting for specialist gender-affirming clinical care. This study will prospectively evaluate the health outcomes and well being of a large cohort of TGD children and adolescents who received such care. By doing so
column4: this research will address critical knowledge gaps in this important and emerging area of health care so as to maximise health outcomes and minimise harm for this vulnerable group."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006611^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006611"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Clinical trial to determine the effects of statins on cognition: STAREE-Mind
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"Statins may improve brain health in older individuals but there is need for a large randomised trial to directly address this important question. This study of 10
column3: 000 community dwelling older individuals aged 70 years and over will provide crucial
column4: high quality evidence on the effects of statins on cognitive function and dementia."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006658^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006658"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Food allergy in the first 15 year of life: wave 5 of the HealthNuts longitudinal study
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"Understanding why some food allergy persists into adolescence is critical because adolescents are at highest risk of life-threatening allergic reactions. Food allergy also has lifelong impacts on children's health. HealthNuts is a longitudinal study of 5300 children that measured allergic diseases from infancy. At the age 15 follow-up
column3: we will identify predictors of food allergy persistence and severity
column4: and the consequences of infant food allergy on later respiratory health."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006773^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006773"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The effect of high SPF sunscreen application on vitamin D
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"Sunscreen prevents sunburn and skin cancer
column3: and current guidelines are that it should be routinely used when the maximum UV index is forecast to reach at least 3. However
column4: applying sunscreen in laboratory experiments reduces vitamin D production
column5: and there is concern that regular application of high SPF sunscreens might increase the risk of vitamin D deficiency. We propose a randomised controlled trial to determine if adhering to the current guidelines decreases vitamin D."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006867^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006867"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"ACTIVE STRIDES-CP: Randomised trial of Intensive Rehabilitation (Combined Intensive Gait and Cycling Training) for children with moderate to severe bilateral cerebral palsy
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"In Australia
column4: 000 people have cerebral palsy
column5: and 40% experience moderate to severe difficulties with movement and reduced participation in physical activity. There are currently no effective interventions for children with moderate to severe CP to improve their ability to move
column6: perform daily life tasks and engage in physically active leisure. We have promising data about a new intervention
column7: called Active Strides-CP
column8: which we will test in 150 children with CP and compare to usual care."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006883^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006883"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Predicting Renal
column2: Ophthalmic and Heart Events in the Aboriginal Community: The PROPHECY Diabetes Multi-Omics Cohort Study
column3: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"Diabetes is at epidemic levels in Indigenous Australians
column4: impairing quality of life
column5: and contributing to poor health. This is a result of rapid development of kidney
column6: heart and eye complications. We have established a large long-term population study among Aboriginal communities within South Australia and will explore the burden
column7: natural history and the social
column8: psychological
column10: clinical and genomic predictors of diabetes and its complications."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006893^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006893"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A randomised trial of the effects of SGLT2 inhibition versus metformin on decline in renal function when used as first line therapy in type 2 diabetes
column2: Clinical Trials and Cohort Studies Grants"^"Type 2 diabetes affects 5 in 100 Australians with many going on to develop serious heart and kidney complications. Sodium glucose co-transporter 2 (SGLT2) inhibitors are a new type of medicine that may provide benefit when used early in diabetes
column3: but that are currently only used once complications have developed. This study will test the value of SGLT2 inhibitor treatment for kidney protection in Australians with newly diagnosed type 2 diabetes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006514^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006514"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A Centre for Research Excellence to Transform Outcomes of Critically Ill Patients in ICU (CRE-ICU)
column2: Centres of Research Excellence"^"Patients who are admitted to intensive care (ICU) and require mechanical ventilation for life support account for 63
column3: 000 ICU admissions and 8
column4: 190 deaths each year in Australia
column5: higher than the national road toll. CRE-ICU will transform outcomes for these patients by using data within registries and electronic medical records to perform high-impact
column6: low cost clinical trials
column7: generating new knowledge to inform national guidelines and policies and training the next generation of researchers."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006523^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006523"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Centre of Research Excellence in Stillbirth
column2: Centres of Research Excellence"^"In Australia
column3: over 2000 families suffer the tragedy of stillbirth each year. By building on our achievements of the first Stillbirth CRE rapidly translating new research into maternity care
column4: we will reduce stillbirth rates by 20%
column5: and reduce inequities in stillbirth rates by Australia by 2025. We also anticipate a reduction in adverse neonatal outcomes. When stillbirth or neonatal death does occur
column6: our research aims to ensure that all women and families receive optimal care."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006545^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006545"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Wiser healthcare: better value care for all Australians
column2: Centres of Research Excellence"^"This CRE develops a new solutions-based approach to overuse of unnecessary
column3: ineffective healthcare. Overuse causes harm and diverts resources from areas of need. We will produce new solutions to address four drivers of overuse. We will: build health literacy in patients
column4: communities and health professionals; respond to changing screening and diagnostic technology; address financial drivers; and change clinical practices
column5: to minimise harm and waste
column6: achieving more sustainable healthcare for all."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006551^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006551"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Skin Imaging and Precision Diagnosis
column2: Centres of Research Excellence"^"Skin cancers
column3: including melanoma
column4: present a significant health
column5: social and economic burden in Australia. Despite the rising incidence of melanoma
column6: the most deadly form of skin cancer
column7: there is currently no national or population-based screening program available. The aim of this CRE is to identify how novel skin imaging technologies can be integrated into the pathway to improve early detection
column8: and ultimately reduce the health and economic burden caused by melanoma skin cancer."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006579^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006579"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"CRE for Better Outcomes in Inflammatory Arthritis
column2: Centres of Research Excellence"^"We aim to find the right treatment for children and adults with inflammatory arthritis to give the best path to symptom relief with least risk of side effects. We will build on our national data-base and biospecimens bank (A3BC-ARAD) to collect a broad range of patient-reported
column3: biological
column4: environmental and health information to unlock the answers using big-data analysis. We will build a resource and workforce to continue to look for cures to deliver the best outcomes for patients and society."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006595^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006595"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"BREATHE - mitigating airborne threats to health
column2: Centres of Research Excellence"^"The COVID-19 pandemic has highlighted the risk of closed
column3: indoor settings due to accumulation of aerosols generated from breathing
column4: speaking
column5: coughing or sneezing. Any airborne threat
column6: whether an infectious virus or a chemical agent
column7: will create a higher exposure in indoor settings. To mitigate this risk
column8: using inter-disciplinary expertise
column10: reduce health impacts of airborne threats

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006620^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006620"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Healthy Food
column2: Healthy Planet
column3: Healthy People
column4: Centres of Research Excellence"^"Food is the biggest issue for health on the planet. High levels of obesity and related illnesses such as heart disease
column5: diabetes
column6: and cancer highlight the need for consumers to have better access to meaningful nutrition information across more food choice contexts. The substantial contribution of the food system to climate change means consumers
column7: industry
column8: and governments need information about which products are better or worse for the environment. This Centre will provide this information."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006765^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006765"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Vascular Contributions to Dementia (VCD-CRE) - a transformative approach to reducing the burden of cognitive disorders
column2: Centres of Research Excellence"^"The total contribution of vascular pathology to dementia is estimated to be as high as 50-70%. The Vascular Contributions to Dementia CRE brings together leading researchers in cerebrovascular disease and dementia to address the most important issues relating to the epidemiology of Vascular Dementia
column3: its robust biomarkers and its treatment and prevention
column4: so as to reduce its overall health burden
column5: and meet the promise of vascular dementia as a truly 'preventable dementia''."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006797^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006797"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"On TRACK (Teaching
column2: Research And Community Knowledges) : CRE promoting brain health with older Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.
column3: Centres of Research Excellence"^"Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples experience high rates of dementia at younger ages of onset
column4: having far reaching consequences for the person
column5: their family and their communities. The OnTRACK (Teaching
column6: Research and Community Knowledges) Centre for Research Excellence will generate knowledge about culturally safe approaches to optimise the well being and quality of life of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples at risk of or living with dementia."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006841^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006841"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Centre for Research Excellence in Developmental and Epileptic Encephalopathies
column2: Centres of Research Excellence"^"We will study the clinical
column3: genetic and psychological aspects of patients with the most severe group of epilepsies
column4: the Developmental and Epileptic Encephalopathies (DEEs). We will define the clinical spectrum of each genetic DEE
column5: improve health outcomes through understanding the natural history of these diseases
column6: build an integrated model of care
column7: produce family resources and assess health economic impacts. This program will ensure Australia is poised for emerging Precision Medicine trials."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006899^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006899"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Centre of Research Excellence in Precision Public Health Approaches to Breast Cancer Screening
column2: Early Detection and Mortality Reduction
column3: Centres of Research Excellence"^"The ultimate aim of the CRE is to make it possible to further reduce mortality from breast cancer
column4: and in a more effective way
column5: by identifying women at vastly different levels of risk at younger ages
column6: determining which screening modalities are likely to be more effective
column7: and helping radiologists to better detect cancers. Given that digital mammography is the contemporary standard
column8: and the incidence of breast cancer is increasing across the world

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006999^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006999"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Centre of Research Excellence in the Early Prevention of Obesity in Childhood -Translate (EPOCH-Translate)
column2: Centres of Research Excellence"^"Overweight & obesity affect 1:4 Australian children by the time they start school. The Centre of Research Excellence in the Early Prevention of Obesity in Childhood: Translate (EPOCH-translate) brings together researchers from across Australia and New Zealand to work out how best to prevent obesity in children aged 0-5 years. We will look at what works in the long-term
column3: what is the best value for money
column4: and what works for parents as well as health professionals."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007007^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007007"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Centre of Research Excellence - REduce the burden of antimicrobial reSistance through oPtimal
column2: persONalised Dosing (RESPOND)
column3: Centres of Research Excellence"^"Each year more than 17 million people die from infectious diseases. Many of these deaths are due to the poor use of antimicrobial drugs and an increase in infections caused by antimicrobial-resistant 'superbugs'. CRE RESPOND will enable an optimal treatment of infection by empowering clinicians with an evidence-based
column4: patient-centred approach to guide antimicrobial dosing. We will generate new knowledge
column5: educate healthcare workers
column6: and build research capacity through our network of collaborators"^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007026^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007026"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Centre of Research Excellence: Partnering with patients with chronic kidney disease to transform care and outcomes (CRE-PACT)
column2: Centres of Research Excellence"^"CRE-PACT will partner with patients to generate and translate new high-priority evidence to improve outcomes that are important to people living with chronic kidney disease (CKD). We will address the topics and questions most important to patients. We will build the next generation of research leaders and a community of research-ready patient-partners. There will be an integrated pathway for evidence translation and implementation at a global scale to improve patient-centred outcomes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007037^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007037"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Centre of Research Excellence in Enhanced Dementia Diagnosis (CREEDD)
column2: Centres of Research Excellence"^"The diagnosis of dementia is often difficult
column3: especially in its early stages. The current delays and uncertainties in diagnosing dementia cause anxiety in patients and limit treatment options. A number of new technologies have demonstrated their value in clinical dementia research
column4: but have not been adopted into clinical practice. The Centre of Research Excellence in Enhanced Dementia Diagnosis will provide a pathway to implement new technologies to transform dementia diagnosis in Australia."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007049^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007049"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Centre of Research Excellence in Alcohol and Other Drug sector capacity building for outcome focused
column2: evidence based and cost effective care (CRE in AOD -CB)
column3: Centres of Research Excellence"^"AOD use is the number one risk factor for the most death and disability combined in all age groups in Australia. This CRE's mission is to reduce the burden and cost of primary and complex comorbid AOD problems in Australia
column4: by using MBC to increase the capacity of the AOD sector to deliver evidence based
column5: efficient and cost effective care to clients."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007062^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007062"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Centre of Research Excellence - Better Health Outcomes for Compensable Injury
column2: Centres of Research Excellence"^"Many people do not recover after a road traffic injury but develop chronic pain
column3: disability and poor mental health. Health outcomes are worse for people who lodge a claim for injury compensation and/or engage a lawyer. The CRE will extend research and implementation beyond health services to the compensation and legal systems. Results will improve health outcomes advancing knowledge of system processes mediating recovery and implementing interventions that promote not hinder recovery."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008140^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008140"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Reverse or Anatomical (replacement) for Painful Shoulder Osteoarthritis: Differences between Interventions -Aus
column2: International Collaborations"^"Shoulder osteoarthritis is common in older adults
column3: causing severe pain and making daily life difficult. Shoulder replacement is an effective treatment - it replaces the damaged joint with metal and plastic implants. Two types of shoulder replacement exist
column4: but the best option is uncertain as they have not been compared in randomised trials. We will produce evidence about the benefits
column5: harms and cost-effectiveness of each shoulder surgery to enable patients to receive the best type of surgery."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006089^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006089"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Working it Out Together! Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander led co-design for a strong and deadly health workforce
column2: Partnership Projects"^"High primary health care (PHC) workforce turnover and few Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander staff in rural/remote areas affects community trust and cultural safety. This impacts health care quality and costs. This Indigenous-led project sees local communities in four rural/remote areas driving new workforce plans with PHC services and partners. Implementation with continuous evaluation and adaption will increase workforce stability
column3: trust
column4: engagement and health improvements."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006138^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006138"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"BALANCE: Promoting wellBeing in AdoLescent and young Adult caNCEr survivors
column2: Partnership Projects"^"Almost 5000 adolescents and young adults (AYAs) in Australia were diagnosed with cancer in the last 5 years
column3: and many will survive well into adulthood. Survival does not mean AYAs return to their former state of health. They need support to manage the detrimental effects of their cancer experience - support that is scarce in this country. This project tests a lifestyle program to address this issue. We aim to ensure young people who survive cancer have the same quality of life as their peers."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006240^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006240"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Developing a model of Preventative Healthcare for People with Intellectual Disability
column2: Partnership Projects"^"People with intellectual disability face stark health inequalities
column3: die prematurely from potentially avoidable causes and experience poor access to preventative health care. Access to preventative health care is one of the key pillars of Australia's long-term national health plan. This project will find out why there are gaps in preventative health care for people with intellectual disability
column4: determine how these gaps affect people and develop a new model of health care."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006282^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006282"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Enhancing hepatitis C testing and treatment among people who inject drugs in drug treatment settings: the ETHOS III Study
column2: Partnership Projects"^"Progress towards hepatitis C elimination has been slowed. Given that most people with hepatitis C have a history of injecting drug use
column3: reducing hepatitis C burden requires scale-up of enhanced testing and treatment for people who inject drugs. This Partnership project will evaluate an intervention to enhance hepatitis C testing and treatment in drug treatment clinics and develop a translational framework to scale-up hepatitis C care in this setting nationally."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006306^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006306"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Be Healthy: Implementing culturally secure programs for obesity and chronic disease prevention with remote Aboriginal communities and families
column2: Partnership Projects"^"Environments cultivated in recent decades encouraging physical inactivity and poor diet have disproportionately affected Aboriginal people. Appropriate lifestyle modification programs substantially improves outcomes. We have co-designed
column3: piloted and refined the 'Be Healthy' program with Derby Aboriginal people. This project aims to show how this program can be scaled up and transferred to other Aboriginal communities
column4: leading to reduced rates of obesity
column5: and improved health and quality of life."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006448^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006448"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Implementation research to guide the elimination of HIV transmission in NSW
column2: Partnership Projects"^"The implementation of new biomedical forms of HIV prevention since 2015 has been accompanied by a 40% reduction in HIV diagnoses in gay and bisexual men in New South Wales (NSW). Reductions in HIV have been much smaller in the overseas-born
column3: the young
column4: and in those living outside of inner Sydney. We propose a 5-year program of implementation research
column5: integrated with the NSW HIV Strategy 2021-25
column6: which will see NSW become the first jurisdiction globally to virtually eliminate HIV."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006486^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006486"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A digital sexual health hub: Co-design
column2: development and evaluation of an online sexual health clinic
column3: Partnership Projects"^"Sexually transmitted infection rates have increased dramatically in recent years in Australia
column4: with major health consequences - congenital syphilis is killing babies
column5: chlamydia in females is causing pelvic inflammatory disease
column6: increasing the risk of infertility
column7: and drug-resistant gonorrhoea is an urgent global threat. Our specialist sexual health services are at capacity. We will develop an innovative online sexual health hub providing online testing and treatment for STIs and HIV."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006528^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006528"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Prostate Cancer Survivorship Essentials for Men with Prostate Cancer on Androgen Deprivation Therapy: Transforming Care to Improve Outcomes
column2: Partnership Projects"^"Up to half of all men diagnosed with prostate cancer will undergo androgen deprivation therapy (ADT) as part of their treatment at some point. Although ADT is effective in treating prostate cancer
column3: many men will experience considerable side effects that negatively impact their quality of life. This research study will identify if a nurse-led survivorship care intervention
column4: delivered by phone or video-call
column5: improves the quality of life for men with prostate cancer who are receiving ADT."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006628^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006628"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving outcomes for hip osteoarthritis: program evaluation of HipHealth
column2: an evidence-based telehealth exercise and weight loss program
column3: Partnership Projects"^"Hip osteoarthritis is a common problem leading to chronic pain and disability and high rates of joint replacement surgery. This project aims to improve the health and well-being of Australians with hip osteoarthritis (OA) by implementing and evaluating an education
column4: exercise and weight loss program (HipHealth) delivered remotely by physiotherapists and dietitians. The program will be tested in the private health insurance setting with view to future scale-up in this and other settings."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006751^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006751"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Talk stroke: Developing Australia's first National tele stroke framework and communications platform
column2: Partnership Projects"^"Patients with a stroke in the regional areas are twice as likely to suffer significant disability compared to patients living in inner city regions. We propose to develop technology to close this gap
column3: and guide its implementation with a national tele stroke policy framework. The technology we develop with our partner organisations will facilitate tele medicine to close the gaps in critical patient care."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006755^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006755"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Establishing a digital health foundation for outcomes-based diagnostic excellence
column2: safety and value
column3: Partnership Projects"^"Our partnership proposal will lead to the development of a digital infrastructure (involving big data resources and sophisticated decision support systems) as a foundation for outcomes-based research
column4: optimised clinical care processes and translation into policy and practice. The partnership will encompass key research areas involving the quality
column5: safety and value of care in musculoskeletal care
column6: infectious diseases
column7: diabetes care and emergency/intensive care."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006950^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006950"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving physical activity and screen time in Outside School Hours Care through evidence-based guidelines: an effectiveness-implementation hybrid trial
column2: Partnership Projects"^"This study aims to lift the standards of physical activity and screen time offerings in Out of School Hours Care services throughout Australia
column3: by implementing and evaluating newly developed Australian OSHC physical activity and screen time guidelines. The guidelines will be evaluated in a rigorous trial in OSHC services in SA
column4: NSW and WA
column5: prior to national release and evaluation Australia-wide."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006957^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006957"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A National Aged Care Medication Roundtable - Translating aged care data into action to improve quality of care through collaboration and co-design
column2: Partnership Projects"^"Older Australians with the most complex health needs live in residential care. Greater than 80% of residents are on five or more medications daily
column3: and 40% are taking 10 or more. Poor medication management is the greatest source of complaint to the Aged Care Quality & Safety Commission. This project will provide timely information to a group of providers and consumers about the medicines residents receive
column4: identify problem areas and trial innovative interventions to address these issues."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006969^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006969"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Control of neglected tropical diseases in the Pacific: integration of programs to increase their impact
column2: Partnership Projects"^"Our goal is to improve programs to control neglected tropical diseases
column3: diseases of poverty common in Australia's neighbours: Papua New Guinea
column4: Solomon Islands and Vanuatu. Our partners are supporting the Ministries of Health in these countries to implement integrated programs to better control these diseases. Our multidisciplinary research will use improved diagnostics
column5: spatial mapping
column6: health systems
column7: social science and health economics to evaluate this integrated approach to disease control."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006970^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006970"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Implementation of Negative Pressure for Acute Paediatric Burns
column2: Partnership Projects"^"Over 4000 children present to our burns services every year. Contemporary burn care aims to speed up a patients time to healing which directly avoids the child's risk of developing a scar. We know that applying negative pressure wound therapy (NPWT) to a child's burn within 72 hours post injury will improve a child's time to healing
column3: decreasing the risk of scarring & cost of care. Co-developing a NPWT Pathway and implementation strategies will improve outcomes for childhood burns nationally."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006987^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006987"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Integration and expansion of a sentinel surveillance system to improve infectious disease outcomes for Indigenous Australians; the ATLAS network
column2: Partnership Projects"^"Infectious diseases remain a significant health issue for Indigenous Australians. Our proposal is to extend a sentinel surveillance network operating in 32 Aboriginal primary care services
column3: with a focus on sexually transmissible infections and blood borne virsuses. By expanding
column4: we will increase the number of sites
column5: and add vaccine preventable diseases to the network. In doing this
column6: we move from a surveillance system to a research network that can inform health service strategies and practice."^""^""^""^
