column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006061^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006061"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A randomised trial of a Carer End of Life Planning Intervention (CELPI) in people dying with dementia
column2: Targeted Call for Research"^"Dementia is the second highest cause of death in Australia. Although palliative care helps individuals avoid suffering and futile interventions at the end of life
column3: only 6% of people that die of dementia receive such care. Many older people with dementia attend an ED in their final year of life. In CELPI we will trial using that opportunity of an ED visit as the trigger to implement a triad of carer education
column4: access to palliative care and a formal planning process for participants."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006121^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006121"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"IMPART - IMproving PAlliative care in Residential aged care using Telehealth
column2: Targeted Call for Research"^"Sixty-thousand Australians die every year in residential aged care facilities but the quality of their end-of-life care varies. The IMPART program aims to improve palliative care in residential aged care using telehealth. We provide training and palliative-geriatric support to aged care staff and general practitioners to enable timely end-of-life discussions
column3: improve documentation of care preferences
column4: reduce avoidable hospitalisation and improve residents' quality of care at the end of life."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006170^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006170"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving the wellbeing of people with advanced cancer and their family carers: An effectiveness-implementation trial of an Australian dyadic digital health intervention (FOCUSau)
column2: Targeted Call for Research"^"The end-of-life-wishes for many Australians are not upheld which has a negative impact on their quality of life as well as their family carers. However
column3: patient and carer wellbeing is improved when they are supported together. Our research will adapt and then examine the clinical and health economic benefits of an internet-based strategy (developed in the USA) which aims to improve the quality of life of patients with advanced cancer and their family carers."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006283^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2006283"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The Enhanced Advance care planning and life Review Longitudinal Intervention (EARLI) study: Increasing proactive care planning in Australian community aged care settings
column2: Targeted Call for Research"^"The Enhanced Advance care planning and life Review Longitudinal Intervention (EARLI) project will proactively screen older adults at high-risk of health decline and provide assistance to discuss and document preferences for future care. The intervention is implemented in the community aged care setting
column3: through partnerships with home care providers. Expected benefits include increased rates of advance care planning
column4: higher quality documents and improved wellbeing among older adults and carers."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007718^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007718"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Post-stroke depression: vulnerability
column2: mechanisms and novel treatment targets
column3: Investigator Grants"^"People with post-stroke depression have poor rehabilitation outcomes and reduced quality of life. Acute treatment has done very little to shift the burden of disability
column4: which is largely due to the fact that brain-based mechanisms that lead to these problems are poorly understood. This project will combine neuroimaging and computational neuroscience approaches to identify vulnerability states
column5: reveal underlying mechanisms
column6: and propose promising new treatment targets for post-stroke depression."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007722^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007722"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving the health status and reducing the mortality gap for vulnerable young Australians
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Disadvantage and inequality in health status emerge during adolescence and young adulthood
column3: with profound consequences for later life
column4: including premature death. My program of research will for the first-time characterise mortality and access to health care among 700
column5: 000 young Australians who have sought homeless services in the past decade. This work will inform policy regarding vulnerable adolescents and young adults as well as guide a range of services including health care and housing."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007725^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007725"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Priority driven childhood respiratory research
column2: Investigator Grants"^"My research program will focus on childrenâs lung health. I will measure how tissues in the nose fight viruses. These results will help develop new prevention methods and vaccines. Children with cystic fibrosis (CF)
column3: a genetic lung disease
column4: often have difficult-to-treat lung infections. I will use friendly viruses to kill antibiotic-resistant bacteria causing these infections. We will investigate whether wearable devices can detect health changes so children with CF can receive treatment early."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007726^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007726"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Applied research to tackle the Australian poisoning epidemic
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Poisoning is a large and increasing cause of deaths and hospitalisation in Australia. The research will use poisons centre calls
column3: medical and coronial records
column4: and prescribing data to identify agents with higher toxicity. Restrictions or tighter regulation could reduce the risks from such poisoning. This research will also evaluate the effect of recent policies
column5: clinical guidelines
column6: and service enhancements that aim to reduce the harms from poisoning."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007731^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007731"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Prevention is better than cure: Development and implementation of an effective multi-strategy approach for youth suicide prevention
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Suicide is a leading cause of death in young Australians
column3: and young people are consistently identified as a group requiring specific attention in suicide prevention policy. By leading an innovative program of research which focuses on solving how to sustainably embed proven effective prevention practices into key settings of young people
column4: at scale
column5: this Fellowship will enable me to address grand challenges in youth suicide prevention both in Australia and internationally."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007732^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007732"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Engineering T cells to promote peripheral immunity
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Tissue-resident memory T cells (TRM) are key for immune protection against diseases. This has led to much interest in understanding how TRM develop
column3: although elucidation of molecules that regulate TRM formation are still scarce. This project aims to identify genetic regulators of TRM in peripheral organs. Expected outcomes are to identify molecules shaping TRM development and modulate genetic regulators to enhance immune protection against infections and cancer."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007734^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007734"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Generating an effective T-cell based influenza vaccine
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Influenza is a highly contagious
column3: rapidly spreading respiratory pathogen that causes profound morbidity and mortality. Current influenza vaccines are suboptimal
column4: they need to be updated and administered annually
column5: and provide no protection in the event of a pandemic influenza outbreak. This research program will see the development of a novel universal 'one-shotâ influenza vaccine that provides long term protection against both seasonal and newly emerging pandemic influenza strains."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007739^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007739"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Control of cellular homeostasis in health and disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This research program will explore the roles of an essential cellular process called ubiquitination in influencing human health and disease. Abnormal ubiquitination is associated with many human ailments including cancer
column3: inflammatory diseases
column4: cardiovascular diseases and chronic kidney disease. Our research will uncover new mechanisms involved in these common diseases
column5: thus generating new knowledge to better understand
column6: prevent and help develop new therapeutic tools for their treatment."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007741^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007741"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Less pain in the back: how new approaches can improve care for low back pain
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Low back pain causes more disability than any other health condition. Low back pain directly impacts a personâs ability to perform simple daily activities
column3: such as lifting objects
column4: bending and even working. Many treatments currently offered to patients with low back pain may be causing more harm than benefit. The project will improve access to high quality LBP care and will provide knowledge on the safety and efficacy of LBP treatments such as surgery."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007747^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007747"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Advancing Indigenous Australian oral health through clinical trials
column2: cohort studies and surveillance
column3: Investigator Grants"^"There are gaps between what optimises Indigenous Australian oral health and what is experienced in everyday practice. In partnership with Indigenous stakeholders
column4: this proposal will facilitate best practice oral care models for Indigenous Australians and result in: (1) improved Indigenous oral health outcomes; (2) raised standards of oral clinical care for Indigenous Australians through cultural competency workshops and; (3) capacity building of Indigenous oral health workforce."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007765^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007765"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Building a culture of safety in Australian residential aged care facilities
column2: Investigator Grants"^"In Australia
column3: the aged care sector has been challenged by issues of quality and safety
column4: including toxic cultures neglect and poor respect for residents. This research program will identify how the culture of residential aged care facilities affects the safety and quality of care provided to residents and put into action strategies to improve culture and thereby residentsâ outcomes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007769^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007769"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The missing genetics of rare diseases
column2: Investigator Grants"^"to find the genetic causes of rare
column3: often severely debilitating
column4: disease and recurrent miscarriage. These diseases result in a significant burden to the affected individuals and their families and also on Australiaâs health care system. A genetic diagnosis provides families with answers
column5: allows family planning
column6: such that couples do not have another affected pregnancy or child
column7: enables appropriate clinical management and gives researchers targets for development of new therapies."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007778^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007778"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Rapid evolution of a genome editing tool
column2: Investigator Grants"^"CRISPRâCas9 is a powerful DNA targeting tool for genome editing and gene therapy. While the tool already shows promising results
column3: its accuracy is not good enough for use in treatment of patients. I aim to develop a novel
column4: high-throughput directed-evolution tool to improve the accuracy and specificity of Cas9 enzymes. The Cas9 with improved specificity will allow the wider and more reliable use of CRISPR technology in medical applications."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007800^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007800"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Preterm birth and neurodevelopment: improving long-term outcomes
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Globally
column3: more than one in ten babies is born preterm (early). While most preterm babies survive
column4: many face life-long health consequences
column5: including impaired development. My program will focus on three important treatments (magnesium sulphate; omega-3 fatty acids; donor breast milk) for mothers and preterm babies. I will assess the effects of the treatments on preterm birth and long-term development of preterm babies
column6: in order to improve and maximise their use and impact in Australia and beyond."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007812^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007812"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Targeting T cell Interactions for Tailored Immunity
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Dynamic immune cell interactions determine the way our body responds to infection and cancer. My laboratory has developed imaging methods that allow us to observe and track immune cell interactions in real time. We will use this information to catalyse the development of precision immunotherapies that either eliminate chronic infection and cancer
column3: or to prevent current and emerging infectious diseases."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007839^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007839"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Towards Zero Deaths from Melanoma: Innovative Clinical Trials with Multi-omics Analyses
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Australia has the highest incidence of melanoma in the world. Survival in advanced-stage disease has risen from <10% to >50% at 5 yrs in a decade due to the unprecedented success of immunotherapy. But 30% of melanoma patients have had no change in survival due to drug resistance. This research proposal will rapidly develop novel drug therapies using innovative clinical trial designs
column3: collecting unique high-value tumour
column4: blood & stool samples to understand the causes
column5: and conquer drug resistance."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007884^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007884"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Discovery of novel inborn errors of immunity that underlie Common Variable Immunodeficiency
column2: Investigator Grants"^"My research will study the underlying causes of Common Variable Immunodeficiency (CVID)
column3: the most common type of inherited immunodeficiency. It is caused by mutations in genes that are important for normal immune function. However
column4: diagnosis is complex as many different gene mutations cause CVID
column5: and most are still unknown. This research will identify new gene mutations and determine how they cause disease. The findings will support future gene-based diagnoses and guide targeted therapies."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007887^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007887"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Understanding the control of cell death and the functions of the tumour suppressor p53 to develop improved therapies for cancer
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Cancer is a leading cause of morbidity and mortality in Australia and worldwide
column3: imposing a substantial burden on affected families and the health care system. I will build on my previous success of delivering a highly successful new anti-cancer drug (venetoclax) to market by determining the mechanisms that control the killing of cancer cells and the suppression of tumour development. My aim is to kick-start translational programs to develop new anti-cancer drugs."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007896^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007896"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Towards a Mechanistic Understanding of the Causes of Congenital Heart Disease and Associated Extra-Cardiac Anomalies
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Birth defects are common
column3: devastating and costly. Heart defects are the most common type affecting about 9 per 1
column4: 000 babies. In most cases the cause of the birth defect is not known. This research seeks to identify the gene mutations and other factors
column5: that cause birth defects and uses experimental models to understand why babies do not develop normally. This research will help families understand why birth defects occur and will help to prevent some cases in the future."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007901^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007901"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Innovative technologies to improve sexual and reproductive health among women in high-burden
column2: low-resource settings
column3: Investigator Grants"^"I will evaluate novel
column4: newly-available point-of-care technologies to improve sexual and reproductive health outcomes among women living in high-burden
column5: low-resource settings. My vision is to improve the health of women and infants by reducing adverse birth outcomes due to undiagnosed and untreated sexually transmitted infections in pregnancy; and to prevent premature deaths due to cervical cancer by establishing and scaling-up robust clinical screening algorithms."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007904^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007904"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Using translational neuroscience to optimise treatment for older adults with anxiety disorders
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The best way to treat anxiety disorders in older adults remains a critical question. Despite significant advances in our understanding of how we can most effectively reduce fears in younger adults based on experimental neuroscience research
column3: this has not been extended to older adults where age-related changes in cognition may alter the efficacy. This research program will bridge this gap to examine whether treatment for late-life anxiety can be improved by targeting the underlying mechanisms."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007908^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007908"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A curative approach for chronic myeloid leukaemia
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Patients with chronic myeloid leukaemia (CML) still have adverse outcomes in 2021 with the majority requiring ongoing toxic therapy to control their disease. My program will focus on improving outcomes by determining the key genetic events driving drug resistance and disease progression
column3: further developing the new
column4: highly targeted drug asciminib which promises to revolutionise CML therapy
column5: and remove the current barriers to treatment free remission
column6: the ultimate goal of CML therapy today."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007912^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007912"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Precise medication use in people with Alzheimer's disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"New evidence suggests that Alzheimerâs disease (AD) not only affects the brain
column3: but also impacts on how our body handles medicines. That is to say
column4: if one has AD
column5: he/she will have a much higher chance to experience undesirable effects from medication(s). This project aims to develop a dose calculator specifically designed for people with AD
column6: so that they can be given with the right dose of medication for better treatment outcomes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007919^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007919"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Pandemic-proofing our future
column2: Investigator Grants"^"We urgently need to generate better diagnostics and treatments for the next viral pandemic. Here
column3: I will develop novel diagnostics and therapies for both severe influenza virus and coronavirus infections â two viruses of significant pandemic potential. The aim is to bring these treatments and diagnostics to clinical development now
column4: so that we will have a ready stockpile of validated therapeutics and diagnostics to treat infected individuals at the inevitable outset of the next viral pandemic."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007920^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007920"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"New directions in global tuberculosis control
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Tuberculosis (TB) is the greatest infectious killer in history
column3: and still affects 10 million people each year. One third of cases are never diagnosed
column4: and few of the 2 billion people with dormant infection ever receive treatment. This research programme addresses the major gaps in prevention
column5: detection and treatment of TB. A series of trials will help to reduce the spread of infection and improve treatment outcomes globally and in Australia. Findings will underpin new global TB control policies."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007929^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007929"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Harnessing immunity for optimal SARS-CoV-2 and influenza vaccines
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Vaccines are our most important public health measure to combat infection
column3: however the optimal vaccine format and dosing
column4: or duration of immunity towards influenza virus and SARS-CoV-2 is poorly understood. We need to pre-arm our immune system against antigenic drift and future outbreak strains. This proposal will determine the protective potential of broadly-reactive immune responses by current vaccines
column5: recovered patients
column6: and experimental vaccines for influenza viruses and SARS-CoV-2."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007944^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007944"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Harnessing T follicular regulatory cell products and knowledge from monogenic models to improve treatment for autoimmune disorders
column2: Investigator Grants"^"B cells of our immune system that have the potential to destroy our own tissues are normally kept in check by quality controls. If these controls fail
column3: rogue B cells produce harmful antibodies that cause autoimmune diseases like lupus and allergies. We have discovered that a protein previously only known to function in the brain called âneuritinâ keeps B cells in check. Understanding how neuritin acts
column4: may uncover a completely novel and non-toxic treatment for autoimmune diseases and allergies."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007946^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007946"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Modernising cardiac rehabilitation and secondary prevention of heart disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Heart disease causes nearly 20% of deaths around the world. Unfortunately
column3: the ongoing care people receive after they leave hospital has not kept up with medical advances. To fix this
column4: I will lead a team of researchers and clinicians who will unite and join with people with heart disease to change care so it becomes more effective and efficient. I will set up and test tracking and monitoring systems
column5: develop new ways to reach and support more people and improve clinician and researcher training."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007957^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007957"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving maternal metabolic health prior to pregnancy to prevent metabolic disease in the offspring
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The incidence of obesity in Australia is increasing most rapidly in young women of reproductive age. Currently around 1 in 5 Australian women enter pregnancy with obesity. This places both mother and baby at serious risk of complications during the pregnancy. It leaves the baby prone to metabolic diseases
column3: such as obesity
column4: which may present even before school-age. My program of research aims to prevent metabolic disease in children by addressing the health of women before and during pregnancy."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007970^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007970"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Implementing and scaling an evidence-informed model for hip fracture management: harnessing implementation science for complex adaptive healthcare systems
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This project aims to improve the care provided in Australian hospitals for people with hip fractures. Approximately 50
column3: 000 Australians are hospitalised with hip fractures every year. Supporting health professionals to deliver care according to recommended guidelines will assist in reducing wait times for surgery
column4: ensure more Australians with hip fractures get back on their feet after surgery
column5: and help alleviate pain and suffering."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007991^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007991"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving translational pathways in kidney injury: from discovery to clinical practice
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Acute kidney injury is a common cause of death in hospitalized patients
column3: with multiple negative long-term health implications in survivors. It greatly increases the cost of healthcare. No effective treatments exist. New targets for pharmaceutical intervention are desperately needed to improve the clinical outcomes of patients with this devastating disease. This proposal using cutting-edge technology
column4: bioinformatics
column5: drug repurposing and molecular biology to develop potential treatment options."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007996^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2007996"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Unifying epigenetics with long-read sequencing to reveal hidden mechanisms of health and disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Superimposed on the genetic sequence
column3: the "epigenetic state" dictates how genes are expressed and silenced. Disrupted epigenetics are common to many diseases
column4: but we lack a thorough understanding of epigenetics even in health. This project will develop a new and broadly applicable epigenetic toolkit to investigate epigenetic phenomena in patients and mouse models
column5: including an incurable muscular dystrophy. The new insights into epigenetic mechanisms will drive the development of treatments."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008000^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008000"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Developing Genetic Testing Tools for Optimising Pharmacotherapy and Enabling a Precision Mental Health Care
column2: Investigator Grants"^"On average
column3: 30-60% of patients with mental illness receiving medication do not show adequate response to treatment. Novel tools are needed to augment the current âtrial and errorâ approach to treatment selection. Over the next five years
column4: I will apply advanced data science techniques on internationally collected datasets to develop genetic testing tools for optimising the treatment of patients with mental illness. Better prediction of treatment outcomes will reduce the burden of mental illness."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008001^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008001"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Investigating sleep biomarkers of cognitive impairment and improving cognitive outcomes through targeted sleep interventions in adults at risk for dementia
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Sleep disturbance accelerates age-related memory decline and increases dementia risk. Monitoring the brain during sleep to understand how sleep disturbance underpins memory problems and contribute to dementia risk is of critical importance. This work will use innovative technology to identify abnormal brain waves that predict memory deficits and evaluate novel treatments that could enhance sleep and improve memory."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008017^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008017"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Better care for HFpEF patients through integrated basic
column2: clinical and translational research
column3: Investigator Grants"^"Heart failure (HF) is a very common
column4: life-limiting cardiovascular condition in which patients have a poor quality of life and require frequent hospitalization. As the population ages
column5: the burden of HF is increasing and the patterns of HF are changing; 'HFpEF'
column6: in particular
column7: is now the commonest cause of HF and the are no effective treatments. My program of research will address this challenge by comprehensively studying the cause of HFpEF and developing effective treatments."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008018^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008018"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Transformation of the implant paradigm in breast rehabilitation
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Breast reconstruction via silicone implants require in 10-25% of cancer patients 5-10years post-surgery implant removal and/or additional surgery. Scaffold guided breast tissue engineering rooted in convergence of 3D printing
column3: reconstructive surgery
column4: drug delivery
column5: & liposuction processed adipose tissue grafts redefines rehabilitation for the breast cancer patient by providing a holistic therapy that addresses limitations realized with all other contemporary reconstructive surgery procedures."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008019^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008019"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Identifying and addressing preventable causes of asthma over the lifespan
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Asthma is the most common chronic non-communicable disease in children affecting more than 300 million children and adults worldwide. Little is known about what causes asthma so there are few preventive measures and resources are aimed at treating established disease. I aim to discover potential causes of asthma by investigating specific types of asthma (phenotypes) and to translate findings clinical practice and public health guidelines."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008020^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008020"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Maximising quality of life in frontotemporal dementia
column2: Investigator Grants"^"An early diagnosis is essential for the appropriate management of care of individuals with dementia. This is often missed in frontotemporal dementia
column3: because of the variable symptoms and confusion with psychiatric disorders. Over the next 5 years
column4: the objectives of this research program are to improve diagnosis and understanding of disease progression in frontotemporal dementia
column5: and develop relevant therapeutic interventions that will maximise the quality of life of patients and their families."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008024^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008024"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Phage Therapy - a novel solution for difficult-to-treat infections in children
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Phages are viruses that kill bacteria and offer a novel solution to treat infections
column3: including antibiotic-resistant ones. This research aims to develop phage therapy as a treatment option for difficult-to-treat infections in children. It will combine the latest advances in bacterial genomics
column4: rapid phage-bacteria matching and clinical trial methods to assess the value of phage therapy to treat serious infections in children with cystic fibrosis and other chronic debilitating infections."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008064^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008064"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving dementia outcomes with new targets
column2: trials and national standards
column3: Investigator Grants"^"While there is no cure for dementia
column4: we know that almost half the risk for dementia is due to factors that can be tackled from midlife. My work aims to a) improve understanding of how new emerging risk factors
column5: namely sleep disturbance contribute to dementia onset and progression b) generate robust evidence for new treatments targeting modifiable risks and c) change practices in our health services to develop national standards
column6: timely diagnoses and provision of appropriate treatments and care."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008066^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008066"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Molecular innovations for imaging microglial contributions to brain disorders
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Microglia are the main defender cells in our brains. When injury or disease strikes
column3: they rush to the affected area and perform a host of critical jobs to repair the damage caused
column4: although the fine details of how they do this are unknown. I plan to develop molecules that can 1) track microglia when carrying out specific jobs and 2) be detected using a PET scanner to unravel some of these mysteries. This research could lead to better diagnostics and effective treatments for Alzheimerâs disease."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008071^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008071"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Implementing point-of-care tools and precision medicine approaches for antibiotic allergy to improve prescribing and medication safety in health services
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Antibiotic allergies impact 1 in 4 hospitalised patients and range from low-risk allergies which can be removed by a test dose (e.g.
column3: childhood penicillin allergy) to high-risk allergies associated with 25% mortality (e.g.
column4: Stevens-Johnson Syndrome). This program will translate piloted allergy tools into easy-to-use bedside tests
column5: that are able to prevent
column6: diagnose and remove antibiotic allergies to improve safe and appropriate antibiotic prescribing."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008073^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008073"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Reducing self-harm
column2: suicide and early mortality in marginalised young people.
column3: Investigator Grants"^"Rates of mental disorders
column4: self-harm
column5: and suicide are all increasing
column6: yet not enough is currently known to develop effective prevention strategies. My research will generate evidence on which we can base decisions regarding the best treatment options and the young people who will most benefit from them
column7: including vulnerable populations at increased risk â such as young people in contact with the criminal justice system and those presenting to emergency departments following self-harm."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008079^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008079"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving the Impact and Efficiency of Perioperative Clinical Trials
column2: Investigator Grants"^"More than 2 million Australians undergo surgery each year. A high proportion are elderly and many have chronic medical conditions that increase the risk of serious complications
column3: ongoing disability
column4: and death. My research aims to improve the design and usefulness of large clinical trials in perioperative medicine and surgery. Simpler designs that allow faster recruitment and completion at much lower cost
column5: and better value because the trial outcomes are focussed on what matters to the patient."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008090^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008090"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Circadian control of innate immunity: strategies for treatment of chronic diseases
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Living organisms adapt to lightâdark rhythms using internal clocks. This body clock not only regulates our sleep and feeding behaviour but also our immune system. Disruption of the body clock can increase the risk of developing cancer
column3: diabetes and asthma. We will discover how our body clock regulates our immune cells to allow future development of therapeutic targets to control these diseases."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008092^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008092"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Serological Correlates of Protection and Pathogenesis in Infectious and Autoimmune Disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Antibodies are a vital component of the immune response required for protection and control of infectious diseases. Conversely
column3: in rare circumstances
column4: the body can produce antibodies that mistakenly target a personâs own organs
column5: damaging the body. Applying "Systems serology
column6: a novel technology developed by Dr Chung, these studies will dissect how antibodies contribute to protection or pathogenesis of disease, in order to develop improved antibody-based vaccines, therapies and diagnostic tools.^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008096^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008096"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Harnessing cryo-electron microscopy to study the engineering of microtubule networks in cancer and neurogenesis
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Just as our skeletons provide structure to our body and facilitate movement
column3: our cells have internal structures which form a dynamic scaffold. This scaffold is composed of long filaments called microtubules. Microtubules are needed for healthy cell division and growth
column4: but mutations can cause cells to divide too rapidly
column5: resulting in cancer. This research program will focus on elucidating how the microtubule scaffold is constructed and maintained in healthy cells and how mutations cause disease."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008097^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008097"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving cancer outcomes for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander women diagnosed with gynaecological cancers
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander women carry a higher burden of gynaecological cancers relative to other Australian women. Reducing this disparity will require mixed-methods evidence-based action across the cancer care continuum. Guided by an Indigenist research approach
column3: this research program will improve outcomes for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander women diagnosed with gynaecological cancers through cancer prevention and improved the quality of treatment and survivorship care."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008099^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008099"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Public health interventions to control sexually transmitted infections
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Each year there are >600 million new cases of sexually transmissible infections (STIs) which can lead to infertility
column3: neonatal death and cancers. My vision for the next 5 years is to develop and trial more effective interventions which will move Australia and the Asia-Pacific Region substantially closer to the goal of controlling STIs in high-risk populations."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008104^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008104"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Leading the way in mesothelioma â a program of immunotherapy translational research nested within novel clinical trials
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Mesothelioma is a devastating cancer which is almost always fatal. My research is focused on clinical trials in mesothelioma and on understanding
column3: from patient tumour samples and blood samples
column4: why some people respond to treatment and others do not. This research will use cutting edge laboratory techniques to study samples from people participating in a 480-patient clinical trial of chemo-immunotherapy in mesothelioma
column5: in addition to working with animal models of mesothelioma and immunotherapy."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008119^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008119"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Precision Medicine and Cancer Immunotherapy: A Multifactorial Paradigm
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Big data from clinical trials and routine care will be pooled with novel laboratory information generated in collaboration with industry partners to identify biomarkers defining who will and will not respond to immune checkpoint inhibitors in advanced lung cancer. State-of-the-art machine learning and systems biology methodologies will unlock translational world leading insights that enable better treatment decisions and patient outcomes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008129^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008129"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Cardiovascular Disease Prevention in Cancer Survivors by Recognition and Treatment of Subclinical Disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This research program seeks to develop a cardiovascular diseases (CVD) screening program and subsequent risk-based CVD prevention program to reduce the development of CVD in cancer survivors. This is important because survivors are at risk of CVD
column3: both because of their cancer therapy and because the risk factors for cancer are shared with CVD. Early detection of CVD by screening will enable targeted prevention efforts to reduce incident CVD in cancer survivors."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008157^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008157"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A deadly duo: Defining the link between Obstructive Sleep Apnoea and Cardiovascular Disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Obstructive Sleep Apnoea (OSA) is a very common breathing disorder during sleep that causes low oxygen levels and disturbed sleep. This causes individuals to feel tired
column3: increasing the risk of injury and reducing quality of life. OSA directly affects the heart and increases the risk of high blood pressure
column4: heart attack
column5: heart rhythm disorders
column6: and stroke. This project aims to better understand this connection and to determine whether effective treatment of OSA improves heart health."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008166^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008166"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Gene2Care: a comprehensive program of research to revolutionise care for children with rare genetic conditions
column2: Investigator Grants"^"There are at least 1.3 million Australians with a rare genetic disease. 1 in 2 patients with rare genetic diseases are children. 6 out of 10 deaths in childhood are attributed to rare disease. Gene2Care will explore how to improve the patient journey for children with rare genetic diseases and their families. We will find out how to get genetic diagnoses for more children
column3: more quickly. We will show how to move from a diagnosis to the best possible lifelong support and care."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008170^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008170"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Men in Mind: Training clinicians to engage men in mental health treatment
column2: Investigator Grants"^"While more men than ever are seeking help for their mental health
column3: the male suicide rate is high and rising. The onus needs to move away from the male client adapting to treatment
column4: and onto the systems and services designed to help them. This project focuses on training clinicians who work with men
column5: to ensure they have evidence-based education to better understand and respond to their male clients' distress and suicidality."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008190^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008190"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Advanced graph genome analytics for clinical and public health genomics
column2: Investigator Grants"^"By analysing the DNA of infectious microbes
column3: public health officials can determine whether patients are part of the same or different outbreaks
column4: and even determine the source of the outbreak. This has become common practice for many diseases
column5: but genome data is rich and could be used to do much more. The proposed work enhances public health by providing advanced data analytics that will increase the precision of existing analyses and extends them to outbreaks of antibiotic resistance genes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008193^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008193"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Transforming outcomes by investigating integrated treatments for methamphetamine use and trauma
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Methamphetamine use disorder is associated with a $5 billion burden annually in Australia
column3: in part due to untreated co-occurring mental health problems. This program of research will address a gap in the treatment of methamphetamine use
column4: by firstly quantifying the prevalence and impact of trauma and post-traumatic stress disorder in people who use methamphetamine; and secondly
column5: by testing two new targeted approaches for trauma and methamphetamine use."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008197^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008197"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Investigating body clock dysfunction in mood disorders using wearable sensors
column2: Investigator Grants"^"We don't yet understand what causes depression and bipolar disorder or why some people don't get better after treatment. This Investigator Fellowship will allow me to explore whether dysfunction of âbiological clocksââwhich control the timing of most of our behaviours and bodily functionsâare responsible for a number of problems that young people with mood disorders face
column3: including fatigue
column4: depressed mood
column5: sleep/wake cycle irregularities
column6: and bodily symptoms like upset stomach and muscle pain."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008212^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008212"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving preterm respiratory outcomes from birth
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Rates of preterm birth are increasing
column3: and survivors are now entering adulthood with chronic respiratory problems. My program addresses the clear need to re-define how we manage the fragile lung of preterm infants from their very first breaths
column4: before the injury events leading to life long problems occur. My program uses world-leading lung imaging and molecular tools and large trials to understand the preterm lung and then develop new therapies that meaningfully impact infants and families."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008255^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008255"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Interstitial lung disease: Improving patient outcomes through risk prediction and disease burden management
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Interstitial lung diseases (ILD) are complex incurable lung scarring conditions
column3: which cause distressing breathlessness
column4: fatigue
column5: and poor quality of life. It is the second most common cause of death due to chronic lung disease in Australia. My program will allow us to predict how the disease worsens over time
column6: to understand how sleep and drug complexity affect health outcomes
column7: and to better treat debilitating shortness of breath and low oxygen levels in people with ILD."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008276^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008276"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving health outcomes for people who inject drugs: hepatitis C and drug dependence
column2: Investigator Grants"^"People who inject drugs are a vulnerable population within society. Recent advances in treatment of hepatitis C have provided optimism for improved health outcomes for people who inject drugs. Addressing other areas
column3: particularly management of drug dependency
column4: is essential to improving the lives of people who inject drugs."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008287^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008287"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Immunotherapy to prevent and cure autoimmune disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Autoimmune diseases such as rheumatoid arthritis (RA) are incurable
column3: inflammatory diseases
column4: causing disability and early death. Building on early phase immunotherapy trials
column5: my program develops ground-breaking immunotherapy research and technology to deliver: 1) tools to identify people at risk; and 2) preventive immunotherapy and lifestyle interventions to halt disease progression. My program will build pipeline drug development and delivery opportunities with industry to transform healthcare."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008300^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008300"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Maximising health and wellbeing for children with serious illness in countries with the most
column2: through to the least
column3: resources.
column4: Investigator Grants"^"More than 10% of all children have a serious/chronic illness. My research aims to maximise their health and wellbeing by rolling out interventions to support families of seriously ill children across Australia. My new interventions will improve mental health in families undergoing paediatric precision medicine and improve quality of life
column5: resilience
column6: physical activity and diet in child cancer survivors. The program will also expand to low resource settings to reach those with the greatest need."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008313^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008313"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"PLACE (Prioritising Location-based Analysis and Consumer Engagement) for Change
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Location plays a key role in Australiaâs health inequities
column3: yet is usually ignored or aggregated to large regions. This hinders identifying appropriate
column4: localised solutions. This fellowship uniquely incorporates both complex spatial analyses and lived consumer experience to identify priority areas and propose actionable solutions to help reduce health inequities for cancer
column5: diabetes and injuries."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008317^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008317"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving survival in lung cancer using novel minimally invasive bronchoscopic techniques
column2: Investigator Grants"^"I will develop novel techniques to achieve tumour destruction via bronchoscopy for non-surgical cure of early stage lung cancer. I will explore the immune system response to tumour destruction
column3: and determine the efficacy of combining tumour ablation (to enhance immune system recognition of tumour cells) with immunotherapy in patients with metastatic lung cancer to increase the proportion of patients who respond to immunotherapy
column4: and increase the duration that responses are maintained."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008339^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008339"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Defining pathogenic mechanisms to improve diagnosis and treatment of antibody-associated neurological disorders
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Autoimmune neurological disorders have recently been identified
column3: and can result in severe disability including blindness
column4: paralysis
column5: and seizures. If diagnosed early and treated with specific immune therapy
column6: brain injury can be reversed and patients can have a normal life. My program will identify how frequent these disorders are
column7: increase our understanding of underlying disease processes to identify new treatment targets
column8: and develop diagnostic and therapeutic guidelines to improve outcomes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008341^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008341"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A personalised pharmacogenomic approach to inform autosomal dominant hypocalcaemia treatment
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Autosomal dominant hypocalcemia (ADH) is a rare disorder caused by genetic mutations that disrupt the bodyâs ability to retain calcium. There is no treatment for ADH. Developing new therapies has been difficult as potential drugs behave differently depending on the underlying mutation. My research is characterising how mutations in ADH can change drug behaviour. I am using this information to design new therapies resistant to these effects
column3: providing treatment options for ADH sufferers."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008344^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008344"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Sex differences in alcohol use disorders: harnessing reverse translation for target discovery
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Alcohol use disorders are a major socioeconomic burden on society and treatment options are inadequate. One of the major hurdles in treatment development is translation from preclinical to clinical models
column3: which in part is underpinned by a lack of appropriate examination in both male and female research subjects. My research will identify and characterise new targets for the treatment of alcohol use disorder in both men and women."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008347^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008347"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Developing novel therapeutic approaches by using innate lymphoid cells in chronic kidney disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Chronic kidney disease is a major cause of death and morbidity in Australia. Current strategies that delay progression of kidney disease are limited. Innate lymphoid cells (ILC) are a newly identified family of immune cells and include two protective subsets of ILC: regulatory ILC (ILCreg) and type 2 ILC (ILC2)
column3: which have been shown to suppress inflammation and promote tissue repair. The project will explore therapeutic potential of ILCreg and ILC2 in kidney disease."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008356^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008356"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Germinal centres
column2: antibodies and immunological disease
column3: Investigator Grants"^"Antibodies that latch strongly onto foreign pathogens provide us with immunological protection. They are produced by lymphocytes called B cells participating in the germinal centre phase of the immune response. Autoantibodies that attack the bodyâs own tissues are an unwanted by-product of the germinal centre. The aim of this study is to identify the processes by which B cells producing desirable protective antibodies versus autoantibodies are identified and controlled in the germinal centre."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008359^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008359"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Investigating new targets and treatments for Alzheimerâs disease: from biochemistry through to clinical trial
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Alzheimerâs disease is a major disease of the elderly that causes profound impairment to cognition. This disease has proven difficult to diagnose and treat. Over the next 5 years I will take advantage of our new laboratory research to test new drugs and diagnostics for Alzheimerâs disease. I will test in a clinical trial of Alzheimerâs patients whether a drug candidate slows disease progression
column3: and test whether new technologies can be used to diagnose Alzheimerâs disease."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008375^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008375"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Co-designed Critical Care Recovery
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This research aims to improve patient and family outcomes following critical illness by developing and evaluating a novel and promising intervention - peer support delivered virtually
column3: where survivors can support each other to recover. The outcomes from this research will include two co-designed peer support interventions that can be delivered virtually. This will reduce inequities in access to recovery programs following critical illness in Australia
column4: and will have global impact."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008376^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008376"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Harnessing the regenerative potential of the newborn heart.
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Heart failure is a massive and growing public health problem affecting over 25 million people worldwide. In contrast to the extremely limited regenerative capacity of the adult heart
column3: we have discovered that the newborn mammalian heart retains a robust capacity for regeneration for a short period after birth. This Investigator Grant seeks to unlock the regenerative potential of the newborn heart for cardiac repair in children and adults with heart failure."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008379^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008379"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Optimising the uptake of effective underused evidence-based non-drug interventions in primary care
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Non-drug treatments
column3: such as exercise for low back pain or behavioural therapy for depression
column4: can be equally or more effective than drugs - with fewer side effects. Despite cliniciansâ and patientsâ growing interest in non-drug treatments
column5: they are less known and used. My research program will develop evidence-based guides for effective non-drug treatments and provide world-first evidence on the best way to improve the uptake of non-drug treatments by clinicians and patients in primary care."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008382^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008382"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Preventing Irreversible Vision Loss from Age-Related Macular Degeneration
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Age-related macular degeneration (AMD) is the leading cause of irreversible central vison loss in people over 50 years old. No treatments are available to slow or prevent degeneration of the tissue responsible for vision from the more common âdryâ form of AMD. This project will use state-of-the-art imaging
column3: vision testing and artificial intelligence to substantially improve our assessment of new treatments
column4: and to gain critical insights into disease mechanisms
column5: needed for treatment discovery."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008392^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008392"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Building evidence for strategies to prevent healthcare acquired infections
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Despite being common and affecting 160
column3: 000 Australians a year
column4: strategies to prevent infection acquired healthcare are underpinned by low quality evidence. The proposed research program consists of three discrete
column5: inter-related projects. The work will provide evidence for practical measures to reduce common infections â urinary tract infection
column6: pneumonia as well as improving cleaning in healthcare."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008408^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008408"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Understanding how DC-T cell interactions regulate human disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"My research has played a significant role in understanding how certain immune cells instruct the body to eliminate infections. Building on this expertise
column3: my team and I will address fundamental question of immune cell function that will be vital for understanding immunity and to develop better therapies against virus infections."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008426^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008426"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A new systems approach to discharge and follow up care models for chronic conditions in Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander children.
column2: Investigator Grants"^"A program providing culturally safe discharge planning for Aboriginal children with a burn injury will be trailed in Darwin and Townsville. It includes a component âBuilding Cultural Capabilitiesâ an educational program for health workers to develop cultural capacity improving healthcare for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander patients. This project will improve the quality and safety of healthcare for Aboriginal children in Darwin and Townsville and will improving burn injury outcomes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008436^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008436"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Reducing the burden of chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (COPD): novel phenotypes
column2: risk factors and biomarkers
column3: Investigator Grants"^"Chronic Obstructive Pulmonary Disease (COPD) is a major public health issue around the world. At present
column4: the only known way to prevent COPD and lessen its severity is tobacco smoking avoidance. However
column5: not everyone who gets COPD smokes and patients with COPD often have different forms of the disease. I will determine the different types and causes of COPD and develop tools to identify who is most at risk. My research will help develop interventions to prevent and better treat COPD."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008447^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008447"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Healthcare resource utilisation and long term outcomes following critical illness
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Patients admitted to intensive care units (ICU) are the sickest patients in hospital but little is known about what happens to these patients after they are discharged. This project will evaluate long-term outcomes such as disability
column3: quality of life
column4: anxiety and depression after ICU
column5: along with ongoing healthcare use (including readmission to hospital). It will also conduct health economic analyses to determine which interventions provide the greatest value for money."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008450^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008450"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Next-generation therapeutics inspired by parasitic helminths
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Billions of people in developing countries are infected with parasitic worms
column3: but they have been eradicated from industrialised nations. Humans co-evolved with worms
column4: so their recent removal has deprived us of signals required to keep inflammation in check. My research focuses on worm molecules that can be used as: (1) vaccines and diagnostics to combat parasitic infections in developing countries
column5: and (2) a novel platform of anti-inflammatory therapeutics for use in industrialised nations."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008454^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008454"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Tailored approaches to improve prevention and early detection of melanoma and other skin cancers
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This proposal will evaluate ways to tailor melanoma and skin cancer prevention and early detection strategies to a personâs individual risk. It will help us understand the overall benefits and harms of different approaches
column3: how to implement good national strategies
column4: and measure the value for money for the health system. This research will improve skin cancer outcomes for the community and patients."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008460^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008460"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Using social media to reduce suicide and self-harm in young people
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This program will address the role of social media on youth suicide and self-harm. It will lead to increased understanding of the harms and benefits of online communication from the perspective of young people
column3: parents
column4: professionals and the social media industry. Outputs include evidence-based guidance plus co-designed social media campaign targeting young people. If effective
column5: this work will directly translate into increased online safety for at-risk young people in Australia and overseas."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008462^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008462"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Developing more accurate cardiovascular disease detection with a cellular-resolution imaging catheter
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Most heart attacks are caused by high-risk plaques. The holy grail in cardiology would be to reliably detect high-risk plaques before they are life-threatening. This research program will deliver a clinically applicable device to detect high-risk plaques
column3: helping cardiologists determine the most efficient treatment on an individual basis. The imaging device will be the first-of-its-kind worldwide
column4: holding great hope of significantly reducing cost and complications in cardiovascular diseases."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008488^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008488"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Optimising outcomes from child concussion from sidelines to recovery: improving diagnostic precision
column2: effective treatment and community knowledge
column3: Investigator Grants"^"In the context of wide media attention
column4: child concussion is of increasing community concern
column5: despite limited empirical evidence regarding its real consequences. My research will identify mechanisms underlying persistent symptoms and link these predictive markers to individual recovery profiles and to treatment responses to optimise outcomes for children with concussion."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008501^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008501"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Interventions to eliminate Plasmodium vivax malaria
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Malaria affects more 230 million people each year. In Asia
column3: the Americas and the Horn of Africa malaria due to Plasmodium vivax accounts for more than half of these cases. I will work with partners in malaria endemic countries to develop better
column4: safer and more effective treatment strategies and design better surveillance to identify populations at greatest risk of infection. The ultimate aim of my program is to change policy
column5: impact on health outcomes and eliminate vivax malaria globally."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008523^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008523"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Reducing the burden of knee osteoarthritis in young adults
column2: Investigator Grants"^"In young people (<40 years)
column3: arthritis commonly occurs after knee injury
column4: forcing them to live with old knees and reducing their quality of life. This program of research leverages established resources to address the urgent need to prevent arthritis in young adults by: i) understanding why some people are more likely to get knee arthritis; ii) enhancing the care of knee injuries to prevent arthritis; and iii) uniting international efforts with a world-first database of early arthritis outcomes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008535^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008535"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Enhancing policy implementation for healthy food environments
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This Investigator Grant aims to enhance the implementation of policies for creating healthy food environments. It is expected that the research program will provide new evidence to support effective policy action
column3: and powerful mechanisms for holding governments and the food industry to account for their roles in improving population diets and preventing obesity. In so doing
column4: the research will improve the policy response to the leading contributors to poor health in Australia and globally."^""^""^""^
