column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008542^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008542"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Harnessing immune cell programs to drive immune protection
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Immunity is essential for life. Harnessing the immune system to drive increased protection against disease has never been more urgent than now. Achieving this requires understanding the cues that regulate the activation of immune cells and the wiring needed for them to function efficiently and defeat pathogens. My work aims to unravel this complex network to harness the immune switches that will facilitate the future development of therapeutics and vaccines to treat world disease."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008546^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008546"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Novel oxygen sensing pathways in hypoxic disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Oxygen (O2) is a vital biological resource and sufficient concentrations are needed for normal metabolism. Reductions in O2 (hypoxia) can cause significant stress that subverts life and is a key feature of disorders such as cancer and cardiovascular disease. By understanding how cells respond to changes in O2 we can develop effective methods to treat these detrimental conditions. This project aims to increase knowledge of a new O2 sensing system to combat hypoxic cancers such as glioblastoma."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008565^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008565"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"From dreams to delirium and dementia: Cognitive fluctuations as a window into novel biomarkers and therapeutic targets for neurodegeneration
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Lewy body dementias are characterized by marked swings in attention and arousal known as cognitive fluctuations. We aim to show that disturbances in the biology maintaining the normal balance between wakefulness and sleep underlie this core symptom and use this to identify new disease biomarkers and novel therapeutic targets of Lewy body disease. We apply this to recruit the first prodromal cohort of delirium-onset Lewy body dementia and to improve prediction and treatment of delirium generally."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008572^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008572"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Phosphatases in the pathogenesis of obesity and cancer
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Obesity has reached epidemic proportions and is major driver of chronic human diseases
column3: including type 2 diabetes
column4: cardiovascular disease
column5: fatty liver disease and cancer. This proposal will define key molecular mechanisms contributing to the development of obesity and its co-morbidities
column6: especially liver disease and cancer. We will thereon seek to develop novel therapeutic approaches for combating obesity and these insidious and recalcitrant diseases."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008574^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008574"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Defining effective health actions for adolescents globally
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The world is now home to 1.8 billion adolescents
column3: the largest population in human history. My earlier work has described the unmet health needs of these adolescents- the task now is to define how to best respond. Working in partnership with adolescents across Indigenous communities
column4: Papua New Guinea and Myanmar
column5: I will define the actions required to improve their health. I will define a package of actions that is informed by adolescents and can be implemented across health and education sectors."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008600^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008600"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Measuring unmet menstrual health needs and their impacts on health and education
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Each day
column3: over 300 million females are menstruating. Their menstrual health matters for gender equality
column4: health
column5: and education. My work will transform the way we measure womenâs and girlsâ menstrual health needs in low- and middle-income countries and advance evidence-based action in Southeast Asia and the Pacific. I will grow our understanding of how adolescent girlsâ needs change over time and quantify the impacts of menstrual health on broader health and education outcomes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008612^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008612"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Generative models of brain disorders
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The management of many neurological and psychiatric disorders remains underwhelming
column3: due in part to of our limited understanding of how the brain works. Consequently
column4: clinical practice remains rooted in trial-and-error and expert opinion. To make progress
column5: we need to improve our knowledge of the brain using tools that embrace its complexity. I will use advanced mathematical modelling to understand the rules that govern neural circuits in health and as they fail in common brain disorders."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008616^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008616"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Immunity mediated by MHC class I-related protein (MR1)
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Immune T cells react to molecular changes in cells during infection revealed by antigen-presenting molecules that constantly sample molecular patterns. MR1 is a newly discovered Ag presentation molecule involved in microbial immunity
column3: but new evidence indicates that MR1 can present unique molecules from cancer cells driving T cell immunity. This proposal seeks to understand this process to harness a new arm of immunity amenable to development of novel anti-tumour vaccines and immunotherapy."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008625^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008625"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Achieving precision care in chronic lung disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Current treatment guidelines poorly manage up to 30% of all patients with a chronic lung disease (CLD). In order to improve this
column3: we need to identify useful disease markers that inform treatment response. Using stored samples and data from thousands of CLD patients
column4: I will meticulously measure markers of disease and identify patient characteristics that inform treatment response. This research will improve guidelines for the large number of patients with poor disease control."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008631^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008631"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving outcomes for patients with homologous recombination deficient cancer
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Some cancers
column3: including ovarian and breast
column4: have faulty DNA repair
column5: which makes them respond to powerful cancer drugs called PARP inhibitors. Unfortunately
column6: many cancers eventually develop resistance to these drugs. I will use genomic technologies to study the portraits of cancers with faulty DNA repair. I will look at how we can prevent resistance to PARP inhibitors and to treat each cancer most effectively. This important work aims to improve the cancer survival rates."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008632^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008632"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving antimicrobial use and reducing harms in children
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Antibiotics are often given to children in hospital incorrectly or for longer than needed. My program makes use of routinely collected Australian data
column3: and introduces improved systems for managing antibiotics in hospital
column4: including guidelines and policy. The program will improve the reporting of how antibiotics are used in Australian hospitals
column5: improve management of those antibiotics in children
column6: and lead to better outcomes for children and families
column7: with less time spent in hospital."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008640^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008640"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Developing Bioinformatics Capability to Diagnose Infectious Diseases using Clinical Metagenomics
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Current methods to identify infectious pathogens are time-consuming
column3: inaccurate
column4: and unable to detect novel pathogens. This research will develop the bioinformatics and clinical tools needed to implement unbiased metagenomic sequencing as an improvement to current practice in pathogen diagnostics. This new approach can be implemented in remote and regional healthcare settings and will have enormous global impact on the worldâs expanding tropical population
column5: who have limited access to healthcare."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008645^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008645"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Bringing artificial intelligence into the real world of healthcare - the implementation challenge
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This research program focuses on three foundational challenges to bringing artificial intelligence (AI) into the clinical world. To ensure AI is safe
column3: the 1st challenge
column4: the program will research optimal mechanisms for surveillance and governance of AI safety. The 2nd challenge addressed is the lack of genuine independent testing of claims for the benefits of AI. The 3rd challenge for clinical AI is that good performance in one setting may not be repeated in even closely related settings."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008648^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008648"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Understanding natural and vaccine-induced immunity to malaria
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Malaria is responsible for the deaths of >400
column3: 000 individuals per year. Eradication of malaria will require a safe and effective vaccine. Vaccine development requires an understanding of the immune responses to malaria parasites and vaccines. The work here aims to understand the necessary components for a successful vaccine and to understand why our immune system struggles to make effective responses to malaria."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008649^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008649"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Transforming Young Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Mental Health through New Knowledge and Co-designed Healings
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Young Indigenous Australians have one of the highest rates of suicide in the world and this tragic situation is worsening. My research program will address this call to action through collaborating with Indigenous youth and experts in the field
column3: including traditional healers
column4: to co-design a scalable Youth Model of Mental Health Care to reduce the rates of inter-generational trauma leading to mental illness and suicide/self-harm in young Indigenous Australians."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008650^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008650"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Integrating social science evidence into the fight against vaccine-preventable and vector-borne diseases in the Australasian
column2: South East Asian and Pacific regions.
column3: Investigator Grants"^"Rejection of preventive health measures like vaccination is a global issue. Knowing what drives it is crucial to how health authorities respond but they donât currently have tools to measure these drivers . This research adds social / behavioural data and new analysis methods to health authoritiesâ toolkit
column4: e allowing new understanding of how diseases behave in human populations
column5: and how humans behave around those diseases
column6: enabling targeted public health interventions to reduce disease."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008652^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008652"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"In situ visualisation of cell fate
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Maintaining millions of blood cells every day is crucial for health and development. When this process is compromised
column3: we can develop a range of diseases including cancer and a compromised immune system. To understand how this complex system is regulated
column4: we have developed technology to watch blood cell behaviour in living tissue. Using this approach
column5: I aim to develop new ways of driving healthy blood cell production and eliminating cells that cause disease."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008692^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008692"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Inflammatory Responses to Programmed Cell Death Signalling
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Inflammatory cytokines are the alarms that cells in our body engage to protect us against infections. However
column3: when made in excess cytokines contribute to diseases such as arthritis
column4: heart disease and hereditary inflammatory syndromes. This project aims to define the molecular mechanisms by which inappropriate cell death induces damaging levels of cytokines to cause disease. Understanding how inflammation is controlled at the molecular level will allow the design of new
column5: targeted
column6: therapies."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008697^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008697"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Geospatial applications for the control of Tropical Infectious Diseases in the Asia-Pacific Region
column2: Investigator Grants"^"My research program will improve geographical mapping to better prevent
column3: detect
column4: and manage malaria
column5: dengue
column6: and intestinal worms in tropical countries. Projects include developing systems to rapidly map and report new cases of malaria to facilitate effective interventions
column7: building an early warning system for dengue
column8: and predicting high-risk areas for intestinal worms. The research will improve in the prediction
column10: and rapid response to control and elimination of these diseases."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008698^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008698"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Novel nanotechnology strategies towards a new paradigm of precision nanomedicine
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Nanotechnology offers exciting prospects for many devastating diseases such as cancer. Despite the clinical success of a few nanomedicines
column3: the development of cancer nanomedicines for effective and targeted delivery to pathogenic areas has been limited. This project aims to develop revolutionising nanomedicines capable of simultaneous administration of two or more drugs in targeted cancer disease for synergistic therapy."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008699^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008699"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Diagnosis and Therapy based on new Mechanisms of Autoinflammatory Disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Mutations of our genetic code can affect cells of our immune system
column3: leading to a functional loss or gain that can cause recurrent infection
column4: or in some cases
column5: promote autoimmunity and autoinflammation. Our investigation of these inborn errors of immunity will advance our understanding of disease mechanisms
column6: and the fundamental workings of our immune system
column7: in order to identify and improve therapies that will potentially treat a range of inflammatory diseases."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008702^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008702"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Moving beyond one-size-fits-all: Exploring the optimal doses of physical activity and sedentary behaviour across the lifespan for prevention of non-communicable chronic diseases
column2: Investigator Grants"^"It is well known that physical inactivity is a risk factor for the development of non-communicable chronic diseases. This research program will determine the optimal doses of physical activity and sedentary behaviour during childhood
column3: adolescence
column4: adulthood and old age to prevent mental and physical health conditions. This research program will inform the development of strategies to reduce the social and fiscal burden of non-communicable chronic diseases in Australia."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008715^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008715"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Towards elimination of tuberculosis
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The development of new safe and effective vaccines is necessary for the control of tuberculosis
column3: the leading infectious cause of death globally. Bacillus Calmette-GuÃ©rin (BCG)
column4: the only licensed tuberculosis vaccine
column5: prevents severe forms of tuberculosis in children
column6: but fails to protect adults. This project aims to further develop a new tuberculosis vaccine
column7: to perform pre-clinical efficacy studies and to increase BCG coverage in vulnerable children in Far North Queensland and Papua New Guinea."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008723^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008723"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Using genetics to identify optimal times to intervene on early life growth and reduce future risk of cardio-metabolic disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The prevalence of cardiovascular disease and diabetes is increasing and the financial burden on society is substantial. Children who have unfavourable growth through early life are at increased risk of these diseases. This study aims to perform the largest genetic study of fetal growth and body mass index over childhood
column3: and then investigate the relationship between early life growth and future risk of diseases like diabetes. Knowledge gained will inform the design of public health initiatives."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008727^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008727"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Identifying the underlying causes and discovering novel therapeutic treatments for chronic visceral pain (CVP)
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Chronic visceral pain is a major but underappreciated clinical
column3: social and economic challenge affecting >1.5 billion people globally. Leading forms of chronic visceral pain include irritable bowel syndrome
column4: endometriosis and bladder pain syndrome
column5: but all lack effective treatments. Using scientific models
column6: human biospecimens and translational science my program will identify the causes of these prevalent forms of chronic pain and develop novel treatments for these debilitating conditions."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008735^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008735"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Real-time prediction and monitoring of head and neck cancer treatment
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Survival in patients with advanced head and neck cancer remains <12 months in the majority. Immunotherapy has durable response
column3: however <20% of patients derive benefit. My program of research uses the patientâs tumour to test responses to new drugs and select the best therapy. The research applied novel
column4: innovative methods and detects cancer using blood samples. Novel clinical trials will be designed to improve patient outcomes and avoid unnecessary side effects and drive down health care cost."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008737^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008737"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Phenotyping Neurobehavioural Disorders in People with Epilepsy
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Neurobehavioural disorders like depression
column3: psychosis
column4: and cognitive impairment are common in people with epilepsy. Recent discoveries suggest there may be a shared genetic underpinning of the two. This project aims to identify whether there are distinct profiles of neurobehavioural disorders in families who carry epilepsy genes. Exploring the genetic basis of neurobehavioural disorders will improve detection and management of comorbid neurobehavioural disorders in epilepsy."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008743^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008743"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A single cell
column2: single molecule and multi-omics approach to identifying novel targets in heart failure
column3: Investigator Grants"^"Heart failure (HF) is a significant problem in our society. Fibrosis is associated with virtually all forms of CV disease and leads to problems with heart contraction. We hypothesise that a deeper understanding of fibrosis will facilitate cardiac regenerative medicine. Our grant focuses on technologies that allow us to understand tissue complexity down to the level of single cells. Applying these methods
column4: we hope to revolutionise our understanding of cardiac health
column5: ageing and disease."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008774^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008774"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Partnering with patients to assess and address loneliness in chronic kidney disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Strong social connections and healthy lifestyles are vital for the health of people with chronic kidney disease. This research program will establish world-first evidence of the predictors and impacts of loneliness in CKD. In partnership with consumers
column3: it will identify patient and caregiver priorities for interventions to reduce loneliness and improve social connections
column4: and implement these patient-prioritised interventions in a novel trial to improve patient-centred care and outcomes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008781^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008781"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Driving Improvements in Ovarian Cancer Survival through Molecular and Clinical Studies
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The Investigator grant would support Professor Bowtell
column3: one of the worldâs leading ovarian cancer researchers. His work focuses on clinical problems of chemotherapy resistance
column4: investigator of rare
column5: exceptional survival patient cohorts
column6: and the development of new therapeutic approaches. His studies are underpinned by the Australian Ovarian Cancer Study (AOCS)
column7: one of the worldâs most sophisticated clinical cohort studies of ovarian cancer."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008793^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008793"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Cell Therapies for Newborn Infants: Translating Promise to Benefits
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Premature babies are at increased risk of brain injury and cerebral palsy. Stem cell therapies offer a paradigm shifting treatment strategy for preterm brain injury. Over the next five years
column3: I will lead a world-first research program to evaluate umbilical cord blood derived cell therapies as an early treatment of brain injury in high-risk preterm infants. I will conduct three proof of concept studies that are crucial to progress my research pipeline of cell-based therapies for preterm infants."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008813^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008813"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"New Knowledge and Research Capacity for Health Impacts of Global Environmental Change with Big Data
column2: Novel Approach and New Technology
column3: Investigator Grants"^"This Investigator Grant research program will produce extremely significant outputs
column4: including transformative changes to guidelines on global environmental change (e.g.
column5: climate change adaptation strategy
column6: air quality standard and extreme weathersâ early warning system)
column7: new information to ensure direct impacts on public health policy and practice
column8: and development of novel research methods for environmental epidemiology and strengthening the Australiaâs leadership in the field."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008839^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008839"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving outcomes for people with Illness Anxiety Disorder
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Illness anxiety disorder emerges early in life
column3: causing great distress and disability
column4: but if we detect and treat it early
column5: this can yield great benefits in quality of life
column6: and improved mental and physical health. This program of research will discover the best ways to assess
column7: diagnose
column8: and detect Illness anxiety disorder
column9: improve access to evidence-based treatment using technology-based solutions
column10: and develop new and improved treatments for Illness Anxiety Disorder."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008853^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008853"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Age-associated properties of intraepithelial lymphocytes
column2: and their relation to intestinal diseases
column3: Investigator Grants"^"Inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) and colorectal cancer are a severe burden to those affected. While the peak onset age of IBD lies in early adulthood
column4: colorectal cancer predominantly affects people over 50 years of age. How gut immunity fails in the context of age is poorly understood. This program will establish cornerstones of the intestinal immune system over different stages in life
column5: and thereby help to design better treatment strategies that are adjusted to an individualâs age."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008871^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008871"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Repetitive DNA as a contributing factor to tauopathy
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The genome contains many regions of repetitive DNA sequence
column3: some of which
column4: termed mobile elements
column5: can "copy-and-paste" themselves into new segments of the host genetic material. While a lot is known about the molecular mechanism behind their mobility
column6: less is known about how mobile elements contribute to diseased states such as neurodegeneration. This project will investigate how mobile elements are regulated in tau pathology and whether this is age- or cell-specific."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008887^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008887"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Microbiome Manipulation to Treat and Cure Inflammatory Bowel Disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Immunosuppressive therapies for inflammatory bowel disease cause side effects and often donât achieve remission. Targeting gut bacteria
column3: which cause these disorders
column4: is a promising alternative strategy. My programs have shown that faecal transplantation (FMT) is effective in ulcerative colitis
column5: and identified key causative & protective bacteria. I will now assess FMT in Crohnâs disease
column6: define how diet & bacteria combined cause inflammation
column7: and identify bacteria causing disease complications."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008909^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008909"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving Outcomes in Inflammatory Bowel Disease: A Multifaceted Program of Research
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Inflammatory bowel diseases (IBD) are chronic disorders involving damage to the gut. IBD is thought to result from an inherited tendency to develop an exaggerated immune response to the gut bugs. IBD adversely impacts patientsâ quality of life
column3: psychological and social functioning. This research program seeks to develop new treatments and use existing treatments more effectively
column4: discover factors contributing to IBD development and explore cost-effective ways of optimally caring for patients."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008911^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008911"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Reducing the food allergy epidemic through prevention and early intervention
column2: Investigator Grants"^"One in ten Australian infants has food allergy. My research program aims to reduce this burden and give every child the best chance of going to school without food allergy. Using high-quality clinical trials
column3: I will test strategies to prevent food allergy (e.g.: infant vitamin D drops)
column4: and early intervention strategies to treat young children newly diagnosed with food allergy. Through established national collaborations
column5: I will ensure my research findings rapidly become standard clinical care."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008913^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008913"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Unconventional T cells: Fundamental biology and therapeutic potential
column2: Investigator Grants"^"There are many cell types in the human immune system that we still do not understand
column3: in particular
column4: a group of white blood cells broadly known as unconventional T cells. These cells detect abnormalities in molecules such as lipids
column5: signatures of microbial infection
column6: and drug metabolites
column7: and they play a unique role in infection
column8: cancer
column11: and tissue maintenance. This project aims to better understand the development and function of these cells in health and disease."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008920^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008920"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Taking neuroinflammation out of TDP-43 proteinopathies
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Abnormal accumulation of proteins inside cells of the central nervous system is a disease hallmark of ALS/FTLD. I have discovered that one protein in particular
column3: TDP-43
column4: triggers an inflammatory response that precedes overt disease symptoms. My investigation of this inflammatory pathway will define how it triggers cell death. Further
column5: understanding how TDP-43 causes disease will aid drug development and advance our knowledge of the pathogenesis of these incurable conditions."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008921^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008921"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Better treatments for autoimmune kidney disease and vasculitis
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Severe kidney disease caused by autoimmune inflammation of small blood vessels has no cure
column3: and treatments cause significant side effects. However
column4: opportunities exist for therapies that target only the abnormal parts of the immune response. Work in this application will provide a pathway for the development and testing of these new approaches
column5: by understanding how disease occurs and which parts of the critical proteins involved are the culprits in these damaging and debilitating diseases."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008928^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008928"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"SPatially ACcurate Evaluation (SPACE) of Cancer Biopsies
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Almost all suspected cancer patients have tissue biopsies manually examined. For decades
column3: histological images are essential for diagnosis and treatment-decision making. Such an image diagnosis
column4: however
column5: fails to identify many cell types and their molecular signatures that underpin cancer metastasis. This program aims to establish a paradigm-shifting approach that maps spatially defined molecular data to tissue images
column6: allowing for mechanistic understandings and accurate prediction of metastasis."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008955^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008955"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"CultureCare: Co-designing an aged care decision aid for the South Asian communities to empower informed and culturally safe decision making about aged care services
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This program of work seeks to develop a decision aid to empower older people and their families from South Asian backgrounds to plan
column3: navigate and appraise aged care services to ensure these meet the needs of the older person. In this work
column4: members of the South Asian community will be involved at every step of the project to ensure that the decision aid is culturally relevant
column5: meets the needs of the community and is useful in the decision making process."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008956^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008956"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving the health and wellbeing of transgender Australians
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Transgender Australians are arguably among the most marginalised and socioeconomically disadvantaged groups in our community with high rates of depression
column3: suicidality and a lack of research to guide optimal gender-affirming hormone and surgical interventions. This project will provide robust evidence to improve the health and well-being of the transgender community to guide treatment guidelines
column4: and health policy
column5: to enable trans people to live a life without barriers and discrimination."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008971^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008971"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Nutritional Psychiatry: Investigation and translation of personalised nutritional therapies for depression
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Mental disorders account for the leading cause of disability. Dietary interventions represent a novel efficacious treatment to avert this significant burden. To advance the field of Nutritional Psychiatry
column3: we need to establish how diet affects depression
column4: who is most receptive to treatment
column5: and design guidelines on how best to integrate diet into mental health care. My program of research will advance the evidence base and facilitate translation of this new knowledge into policy and practice."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008981^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008981"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A molecular investigation into T cell antigen receptor function and dysfunction in humans
column2: Investigator Grants"^"I am a biomedical researcher who focuses on understanding processes central to infection and immunity. My research program covers the pathogenesis of infectious human diseases
column3: adaptive and innate immunity and autoimmunity. I use biochemical approaches and structural biology as my main research tool
column4: and my research program
column5: which involves an international network of basic
column6: clinical and industrial collaborators
column7: has considerable relevance to applied outcomes for human immunological diseases."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008983^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008983"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Leveraging human genetics to inform treatment in fatty liver disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Fatty liver disease affects 1 in 3 Australians and a quarter will develop liver failure or cancer; it has no drug treatments. The disease is characterized by tremendous variability in its clinical course
column3: in part due to a lack of understanding of its genetic basis. To move towards personalised medicine
column4: this program will undertake human and small animal studies to develop novel gene-based tests for diagnostics and risk classification and identify genes that are targets for drug development."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008990^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008990"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Reducing the burden of DNA viruses on human health
column2: Investigator Grants"^"I aim to improve health by understanding how viruses interact with our bodies. This includes processes inside cells that keep microbes like the cold sore virus dormant. Also the way in which the white blood cells that allow our immune system to remember and respond more quickly to an infection after vaccination choose the parts of a virus to target. Finally we will find ways to help people on some treatments for diseases like multiple sclerosis avoid a common virus that is dangerous for them."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009005^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009005"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Primordial prevention of cardiovascular disease from childhood
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Cardiovascular disease (CVD) is the leading cause of death worldwide. The risk factors for CVD begin to develop in childhood. Given the increasing rates of poor health in children worldwide
column3: my research program will identify factors contributing to cardiovascular health in childhood
column4: establish new ways to detect children at risk of developing CVD
column5: and will develop strategies to improve cardiovascular health in children that can be easily implemented into policy and practice."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009010^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009010"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The Dormant Cancer Cell Life Cycle
column2: Investigator Grants"^"In many major cancers
column3: tumour cells spread to the skeleton and hide there in a long-term âdormantâ state where they resist current therapies. When they are âwoken upâ
column4: they cause cancer relapse
column5: at which point prognosis is poor. My vision is to devise new treatments that eradicate these rare dormant cells
column6: so as to cure cancers that spread to bone. I will achieve this by defining the cell and molecular pathways
column7: in dormant cells and in the surrounding bone
column8: that control dormancy and relapse."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009026^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009026"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Hypoxaemia detection and management for at-risk newborns and children in Sub-Saharan Africa
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Low blood oxygen levels (hypoxaemia) are common in COVID-19
column3: pneumonia
column4: and many other illnesses. In low-resource settings
column5: many patients who need oxygen will not receive it
column6: and could die. My research aims to make oxygen more accessible and safe to patients
column7: particularly small newborns
column8: children
column9: and people living in remote locations. I will test a new device to deliver oxygen to babies more safely
column10: and test whether introducing pulse oximetry to small clinics saves lives."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009035^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009035"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Transforming the prevention and treatment of child and adolescent obesity
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Obesity in children & adolescents is a serious problem with immediate and future complications. My vision is to lead an interdisciplinary program of research in preventing obesity in childhood and providing safe
column3: effective treatments to children and adolescents living with obesity. My work will result in recommendations for targeting early childhood obesity prevention
column4: personalised approaches to obesity treatment
column5: and models of care & costings for paediatric obesity treatment in Australia."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009047^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009047"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Alleviating anaemia in mothers and babies worldwide
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Anaemia can cause fatigue
column3: lethargy
column4: and impair health outcomes during pregnancy and in children
column5: and affects over 1.7 billion people. I will develop and test innovative new solutions to reduce anaemia in children and pregnant mothers
column6: and use samples from these studies to drive new discoveries that will inform development of next generation improved treatments. Finally
column7: I lead the WHO Collaborating Centre on anaemia control
column8: enabling our findings to be quickly translated into practice."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009050^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009050"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Personalising colorectal cancer prevention strategies with a risk stratification tool
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Bowel cancer is the second leading cause of cancer death in Australia. People who are at increased risk for this cancer are recommended to have colonoscopies every 3-5 years
column3: with minimal personalisation to the individualâs risk factors (such as age
column4: diet and lifestyle). This study will develop a computerised risk factor tool to personalise cancer prevention strategies for this high-risk subgroup of the population thereby utilising colonoscopy resources more efficiently."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009062^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009062"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Mining the Molecular Machinery of Cell Death for Novel Drug Targets
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Programmed cell death is a process the body uses to kill cells that are no longer needed
column3: damaged or dangerous
column4: e.g. those that have become cancerous or infected with viruses. Our studies have shown that the pathways that control cell death are targets for therapy
column5: e.g. in cancer. We will continue to uncover the molecular details of how these pathways are regulated to provide new strategies for the development of therapeutic agents to treat diseases characterised by cell death malfunction."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009075^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009075"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Inflammasome inhibitors as new first-in-class anti-inflammatory therapies
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Inflammation drives many devastating human diseases
column3: and there are currently no effective treatments for many such diseases. My research program aims to leverage my validated discovery and development pipeline to deliver new first-in-class anti-inflammatory drugs to treat devastating diseases such as chronic liver disease and inflammatory bowel disease."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009079^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009079"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Harnessing genetics to halt the sneak thief of sight.
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Glaucoma is the leading cause of irreversible blindness worldwide. In the early stages it is asymptomatic
column3: and as such many people present at advanced stages of the disease when irreversible vision loss has already occurred. This research will reduce blindness and visual impairment from glaucoma through an improved prediction of high-risk individuals for developing glaucoma
column4: and by the development of new therapies stemming from a better understanding of the molecular mechanisms of this disease."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009096^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009096"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Fall prevention: innovation and translation
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Falls are a major health care problem for older adults and people with neurodegenerative disorders. This program will evaluate novel fall prevention interventions in older people and people with multiple sclerosis and Parkinsonâs disease. By developing software
column3: diagnostic tools and balance training systems
column4: my program intends to improve the health and wellbeing of older people and clinical populations with balance impairments."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009136^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009136"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Personalised Melanoma Risk Score: Development and Evaluation of a Co-Designed Toolkit for Nation-Wide Implementation
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Personalised risk prediction models that combined the effects of several genetic and non-genetic factors are rapidly being implemented in clinical practice. However
column3: there is little implementation research on personalised risk
column4: and data on the patient reported outcomes and risk management behaviour is scarce. For this study
column5: I will develop a framework that provides guidance regarding optimal risk communication and a pathway for the successful translation of personalised risk information."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009152^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009152"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Stereo-EEG and precision neuropsychology: optimising epilepsy surgery and minimising neurocognitive risk
column2: Investigator Grants"^"To guide safe and successful epilepsy surgery
column3: many patients may require sensors to be placed in the brain to map seizures. Electrical impulses can also be delivered through these sensors to test the function of different brain regions so that important brain structures are not removed. However
column4: we do not know the best way to test language and memory. This project will develop a new method to assess brain function in patients with epilepsy in order to improve surgical outcomes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009163^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009163"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Dissecting the impacts of the bacterial host versus plasmid on the AMR burden
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Plasmids
column3: mobile DNA
column4: transmit antimicrobial resistance (AMR). This project will use an innovative approach of experimental evolution and the latest DNA and RNA sequencing technology to study how AMR plasmids spread and evolve in multidrug-resistant Klebsiella pneumoniae strains within different clinical settings. Expected outcomes include enhanced knowledge in bacterial-plasmid co-evolution critically needed for targeted surveillance
column5: detection and control strategies to curb the spread of AMR."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009177^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009177"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Genetically defining and pharmacologically exploiting new oncogenic dependencies in Myc-driven lymphoid cancer
column2: Investigator Grants"^"I will develop new treatments for blood cancers like multiple myeloma (MM) and B-cell lymphoma that share biological features associated with resistance to conventional treatments. By genetically editing the cancer-causing genes in MM and B-cell lymphoma
column3: I have identified new (non-chemotherapy) drug targets that can overcome treatment resistance. My research will validate such drug targets and devise new therapies to improve patient outcomes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009203^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009203"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving outcomes in patients with sepsis through precision medicine
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Patients with life threatening infections may die or have major residual health issues. Previous attempts to treat such patients have focussed mainly on the infecting agent. It is now recognized that the genetic and biological make-up of the patient also plays a major role in the response to treatment. This work will improve the understanding of life threatening illnesses which will then be used to personalise patient treatments for improving outcomes with life threatening infections."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009209^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009209"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A National Wastewater Surveillance Program for Antimicrobial Resistance
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This fellowship aims to provide a world-class surveillance method for antimicrobial use and antimicrobial resistance genes in Australia's general population through wastewater-based epidemiology. Expected outcomes include building capacity to objectively measure antimicrobial use and antimicrobial resistance in the general population. Significant benefits expected include a cost effective
column3: rapid surveillance tool to meet the emergent needs of bacterial disease outbreaks."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009216^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009216"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Novel approaches to preventing perinatal death and disability from birth asphyxia
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Fetal distress is often caused by lack of oxygen because the poorly functioning placenta limits oxygen and nutrient supply to the baby. Lack of oxygen can cause brain injury and death. Sildenafil increases blood flow to the placenta potentially reducing this risk. The proposed body of work will address this problem and will develop tools to identify at-risk babies and evaluate if Sildenafil reduces the risk of injury related to birth asphyxia and rates of emergency caesarean section."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009231^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009231"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Inflammation and chronic infections in the pathogenesis of Alzheimerâs disease: the role of amyloid cross-seeding.
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This project seeks to evaluate the pathological role of inflammation and infections in the development and progression of Alzheimerâs disease
column3: the most common cause of dementia. The knowledge generated in this study will guide future drug discovery and development approaches against Alzheimerâs disease
column4: especially for people who have faced acute or chronic inflammations or have been affected by bacterial and fungal infections."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009237^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009237"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Neuroinflammation in schizophrenia
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Schizophrenia is debilitating disorder in need of a cure. Inflammation along with macrophage invasion occurs in the brains of ~40-45% of the people with schizophrenia. I aim to block immune cell invasion and test if the symptoms of schizophrenia can be reversed. Through studies of the human brain
column3: basic science studies and novel investigator initiated clinical trials
column4: I will continue to develop strategies to dampen neuroinflammation and to prevent damaging immune cells entering the brain."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009253^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009253"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Strengthen the role of health economics in perinatal health to inform priority setting and funding decisions
column2: Investigator Grants"^"My program will develop new health economics methods to guide government decisions and help achieve the best health outcomes for children through more efficient and fair health care services during pregnancy and the year after birth."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009254^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009254"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Creating an active Australia through active systems: Co-production of multi-sectoral population physical activity strategies
column2: Investigator Grants"^"To prevent chronic disease
column3: Australians need to become more physically active. This proposed research examines the value of solutions that promote physical activity
column4: including changes to urban planning and transport. The research combines scientific evidence and local expertise to develop a decision-making tool to help predict the health
column5: economic and environmental impacts of different solutions. The findings will guide policymakers in adopting the best strategies to promote physical activity."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009264^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009264"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Unravelling the Contributions of Sleep Dysfunction to Alzheimerâs Disease and Dementia
column2: Investigator Grants"^"My research program will determine whether poor sleep should be a therapeutic target for reducing dementia risk. Using longitudinal cohort studies
column3: I will identify the changes in sleep that most strongly predict the risk of Alzheimerâs disease and dementia. Results will guide targeted sleep interventions to reduce dementia risk and help select at risk subjects for inclusion in dementia prevention trials."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009278^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009278"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Mathematical modelling to support policy decisions on COVID-19 vaccination in Australia
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Vaccination against COVID-19 is underway globally. However
column3: even as the virus is controlled by vaccination
column4: it will be very difficult to eliminate COVID-19 completely
column5: and we will need additional vaccine doses to boost protection against current and variant strains. I will use mathematical models to estimate the health benefit of COVID-19 vaccines
column6: and to inform policy planning for longer-term
column7: sustainable COVID-19 vaccine programs in Australia and regionally."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009280^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009280"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Endovascular Neuromodulation
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The blood vessels provide access to regions of brain and nerves in the body that enable treatment with implantable devices. Interventional techniques enable a method of implanting a device while avoiding open brain surgery. Building off of work already achieved over a 6 year period
column3: this grant progresses a body of world-first research that is proving the safety and efficacy of the first applications in paralysis and epilepsy in this new field of medicine."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009283^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009283"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Reducing Resuscitation Errors
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Error-free decisions made during resuscitation are fundamental to the subsequent recovery of the critically ill. A computer-assisted
column3: resuscitation decision support system has already been shown to reduce clinical errors and improve outcomes during the resuscitation of the severely injured. This project will research and develop the system to include cardiac
column4: stroke
column5: sepsis
column6: pediatric
column7: toxidrome and obstetric emergencies and ascertain the effectiveness in these domains as well.."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009287^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009287"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Defining a novel waste disposal mechanism that aids vascular homeostasis and prevents inflammation
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The survival of our cellular building blocks is crucial to prevent disease. One way in which our cells maintain their health is through disposing of cellular waste. This project will investigate a new waste disposal system employed by key cells that line the vascular system. Through advanced mouse models and imaging techniques
column3: this project will determine how our cells survive under healthy and disease conditions
column4: and how disposing of their waste correctly can prevent harmful inflammation."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009288^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009288"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Reproductive bodies across borders: Enhancing fertility management among culturally and linguistically diverse women in Australia.
column2: Investigator Grants"^"This project will explore CALD womenâs perception and experiences of fertility control
column3: focusing on fertility decision-making
column4: contraception
column5: and management of unplanned pregnancies
column6: areas that have previously been underexplored. It will address CALD womenâs health literacy and fertility control support needs through the co-design and evaluation of an online health educational resource
column7: a knowledge translation exhibition and recommendations for health promotion and healthcare provision."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009295^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009295"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Translating lifestyle-based mental health care into practice
column2: Investigator Grants"^"We now know that providing clinical care to people with mental health problems that improves their diet
column3: physical activity and sleep
column4: while reducing their smoking
column5: drug and alcohol use is highly beneficial for their mental health as well as their physical health. Yet this type of care is not typically offered as part of routine mental health care. My research will produce evidence that addresses this gap to improve the lives of individuals with mental health concerns in Australia and beyond."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009303^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009303"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving outcomes in peritoneal dialysis through patient-centred clinical trials
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Globally
column3: the number of people living with kidney disease requiring dialysis or transplantation is growing. Peritoneal dialysis (PD)
column4: a form of home-based therapy
column5: has been promoted by the international community as a solution to overcome this crisis. Yet
column6: globally only 11% of patients on dialysis receive PD and the number of people choosing PD therapy for their kidney disease is declining. My research program is focussed on patient-important outcomes to directly address these deficiencies."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009306^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009306"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Safeguarding the next generation: Using data to map and address injury-related harm in adolescence
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Globally
column3: injury is a preventable cause of harm. This research focuses on preventing injury among adolescents and aims to assess and benchmark data on adolescent injury in Australia and the Western Pacific region
column4: while also expanding understanding of the impact of remoteness and alcohol on adolescent fatal and non-fatal injury in urban and rural New South Wales
column5: informing a pilot co-design process to develop an alcohol and injury prevention intervention for rural dwelling adolescents."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009308^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009308"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Harnessing T cell immunity to boost vaccine efficacy
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The recent SARS-CoV-2 pandemic has highlighted the need for rapid
column3: large-scale vaccine development. This research program will study how specific types of T cells can be activated in order to improve the immune response to vaccines
column4: with the goal of identifying new vaccine platforms that can be successfully deployed in future pandemics. This work will advance our knowledge of vaccine-related immunology and significantly improve human health."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009309^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009309"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Deciphering the impact of non-coding mutations in congenital heart disease
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Enhancers are non-coding regions of genomic DNA that play a crucial role in determining cellular identity. They are over-represented at genetic variants associated with disease. The goal of this proposal is to identify enhancers causal to human disease using in vivo high-throughput imaging and quantitative biology. The focus is to uncover the functional consequences of human enhancer variants in congenital heart disease."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009322^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009322"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Safer anaesthesia for children - optimizing perioperative outcomes by advancing and translating knowledge into clinical practice using an international
column2: interdisciplinary approach
column3: Investigator Grants"^"One in 20 children in Australia undergoes surgery each year. Children are particularly at risk of breathing problems during and after anaesthesia. I am investigating methods to predict
column4: prevent and treat these problems. I am investigating ways to minimise the effects of anaesthesia on the developing brains of babies and improving the clinical tools available to paediatric anaesthetists. My goal is to ensure that when a child needs a vital operation
column5: it is as safe and pain-free as possible."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009323^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009323"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Restoring the Fair Go: which policies and practices are likely to reverse growing health inequities in Australia post-COVID-19
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Australia has become a less equal society. My âRestoring the Fair Goâ program will analyse the underlying economic and health inequity trends
column3: assess the policies that have contributed to these inequalities and determine how these can be reversed. The program will explore Australian policymaker and citizens perspectives on inequality and draw comparisons to other OECD countries. Practical policy proposals will be developed to help Australia build back from COVID-19."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009324^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009324"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Alcohol use during pregnancy: Understanding and improving health outcomes in offspring
column2: Investigator Grants"^"The aim of this research is to gain understanding of how small amounts of alcohol during pregnancy can impact child development across the first two decades of life and to test the effectiveness of a program that aims to reduce some of this burden. The world's largest datasets for examining prenatal alcohol exposure will be used to provide concrete evidence of the impacts. It is anticipated the findings will provide critical new insights important for families
column3: practitioners
column4: and policy-makers."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009326^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009326"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Implementation research: Delivering impact at the interface between reproductive and metabolic womenâs health
column2: Investigator Grants"^"As an active clinician
column3: academic and leader
column4: I bring an exemplary track record
column5: team and research program aiming to generate and translate new knowledge to improve women's health internationally
column6: during the reproductive years and beyond. My research program addresses patient and clinician priorities
column7: links to international guidelines and has far reaching translation programs to directly improve women's health. Target conditions include polycystic ovary syndrome
column8: early menopause and pregnancy."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009336^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009336"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Harnessing tissue-resident regulatory T cells to fight cancer
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Specialised immune cells called regulatory T cells (Tregs) reside in almost all organs of the body where they play a central role in preventing autoimmunity and inflammation. Tregs
column3: however
column4: aggravate cancer by antagonising the activity of beneficial
column5: cancer killing immune cells and limiting cancer immunotherapy. This proposal aims to discover mechanisms utilized by Tregs to populate distinct tissues and tumours. These mechanisms will be harnessed to target Tregs for the treatment of cancer."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009339^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009339"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Harnessing CD4+ Regulatory T Cells to Enhance Formation of Protective Immunity Against Human Viruses
column2: Investigator Grants"^"In order to fight off infection we need specialised white blood cells
column3: called helper T cells
column4: to activate immune responses. A specialised helper T cell
column5: called a regulatory T cell
column6: are key orchestrators of immune memory
column7: which protect against re-infection. This study will explore the role for regulatory T cells in generating protective immunity
column8: which is the foundation of vaccine efficacy. This information will aid the design of better treatments and vaccines for infectious diseases."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009340^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009340"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Personalised Nutrition Support
column2: Investigator Grants"^"My research program in precision and personalised nutrition technologies will generate new knowledge on cost-effective models of care to reduce diet-related health risks
column3: especially for under-served groups based on life-stage
column4: socio-economic status or geographic location. My research findings will improve health and well-being for those at elevated diet-related chronic disease risk and be rapidly translated to lower the healthcare burden related to poor nutrition."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009380^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009380"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Addressing racialised health inequities in cancer
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Cervical cancer can be eliminated by vaccination
column3: screening and treatment (three pillars of elimination). Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander women experience rates of cervical cancer comparable with less developed regions of the world despite other Australian women having the lowest rates in the world. This Indigenous led research program will focus on overcoming racial inequities via strategic culturally safe interventions focused on the three pillars of elimination."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009389^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009389"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving outcomes for people with Multiple Sclerosis
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Multiple sclerosis is a disabling neurological condition with a profound impact on the community. This proposal builds on years of successful MS research to develop a "human" model to study MS. Using advanced genetic techniques to understand why MS is more common in families. To understand how genes
column3: the environment
column4: and personal behaviours influence MS risk and progression. How information can be used to improve MS and how to translate discoveries into meaningful outcomes rapidly."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009408^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009408"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Using modelling to guide the control of hepatitis C as a public health threat
column2: Investigator Grants"^"During this grant I will use epidemic and economic modelling to guide health policy responses to hepatitis C in Australia and internationally. My findings will inform decisions by national governments and global health organisations on how to best find and cure people with hepatitis C. I will leverage my own and my collaboratorsâ memberships on global panels to ensure that lives are saved around the world because approaches to hepatitis C elimination are evidence-based and cost-effective."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009409^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009409"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Mitochondria live imaging in mammalian preimplantation embryos
column2: Investigator Grants"^"One type of organelle
column3: mitochondria
column4: are in the spotlight to improve pregnancy success of women suffering reduced fertility. This project will provide insights into mitochondrial integrity using cutting-edge non-invasive live imaging of the preimplantation embryo. We will uncover in real-time how mitochondria move
column5: being sorted in subpopulations and how the parental mitochondrial heritage plays a role. Our findings will open new ways to refine mitochondrial therapies in reproductive medicine."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009419^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009419"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Reducing the harms of inappropriate medicalisation of women's reproductive health
column2: Investigator Grants"^"Womenâs reproductive health is an under-researched area with many areas of uncertainty
column3: increasing the risk of inappropriate medicalisation and harm. The recent explosion of technology-based products focused on womenâs health is expanding this issue on a massive scale. Using mixed methods and involving key stakeholders
