column3: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Poorly controlled IBD has been shown to negatively affect outcomes for mother and baby. As newer medications become available to treat IBD
column4: it is increasingly important to determine: 1. How disease activity can be accurately and non-invasively monitored in pregnancy. 2. To what degree medications cross the placenta into the baby. 3. For how long medications remain detectable in the baby after delivery. 4. The effect on the babyâs brain and immune system development. PICCOLO-X will address these."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013817^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013817"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Harnessing the power of Patient Reported Outcomes (PROs): demonstrating novel applications of PROs in the care of oncology patients
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Patient-reported outcomes (PROs) empower patients to communicate their symptoms and needs to clinicians. Understanding the impact of treatment from a patientâs perspective is vital to ensure their concerns are addressed and to inform improvements to cancer care. This study will examine new ways of using PROs to understand the patient experience
column3: enable treatment side effects to be captured and communicated with patients
column4: and promote the collection of PROs in clinical registries."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013821^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013821"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Long-term Outcomes of Surgery for Diseases of the Aortic Valve in Children
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Over 2400 children in Australia are born with a heart defect annually. Up to 7% will have an abnormal aortic heart valve and need open-heart surgery in order to survive. Although surgery is often successful
column3: affected children will need multiple heart operations throughout their life and face heart complications and premature death. This study will investigate the long-term outcomes of aortic valve surgery in children and aim to identify strategies to minimise complications and maximise survival."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013829^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013829"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Negative Symptoms of Psychosis
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Impairments in facial expressivity
column3: motivation
column4: and sociality â the ânegative symptomsâ - are the most debilitating features of psychotic disorders
column5: yet they are inadequately treated. In this study
column6: I will use facial emotion detection algorithms
column7: functional brain imaging
column8: and novel tasks including real-time facial feedback and heart rate feedback
column9: to discover the changes in the brainâs emotional circuits that underlie negative symptoms."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013831^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013831"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Evolution of Streptococcal pathovars
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Streptococcus dysgalactiae subspecies equisimilis (group C/G Streptococcus) is a bacterium that is increasingly recognised as a cause of serious human disease. It shares genes and disease manifestations with the closely related bacteria
column3: Streptococcus pyogenes (group A Streptococcus). We aim to analyse a global streptococcal genetic database to identify common drivers of disease and potential shared vaccine targets to inform public health and vaccine approaches to combat streptococcal disease."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013839^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013839"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Towards the understanding of the immunopathogenesis of autoantibody-mediated systemic diseases: new approaches to old problems
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Autoantibodies and white cells called B cells are found in systemic autoimmune diseases such as lupus. These are normally present in healthy individuals but a series of failed checkpoints enable them to go ârogueâ
column3: damage host tissue and cause debilitating symptoms. Understanding their molecular signatures will allow me to understand the processes that occur that lead to autoimmunity. This will help create personalised therapies for patients to âeliminateâ these rogue populations."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013842^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013842"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Meeting an unmet need in systemic sclerosis: defining the burden of arrhythmia and sudden cardiac death
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Scleroderma is an autoimmune condition which damages multiple organs. Scleroderma patients are at risk of heart rhythm abnormalities which can result in sudden death. We do not understand why some people develop heart problems
column3: or how to identify patients at greatest risk of rhythm abnormalities. We aim to determine how often heart rhythm problems occur in scleroderma
column4: to understand how to predict risk of heart rhythm disturbances and potentially prevent them from occurring."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013844^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013844"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Randomised Evaluation of the Impact of Catheter Ablation versus Medical Therapy on Psychological Distress and Neurocognitive Function in Atrial Fibrillation
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Atrial fibrillation (AF)
column3: a type of arrhythmia
column4: is a risk factor for both psychological distress and cognitive decline. This study aims to determine if potentially curative catheter ablation procedures result in a greater improvement in markers of psychological distress and neurocognitive function compared to ongoing anti-arrhythmic drugs. We will also assess if catheter ablation procedures lead to reduced AF burden and hospitalisations as well as improved quality of life and cardiac function."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013845^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013845"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Advancing the prevention and early intervention for co-occurring anxiety and alcohol use disorders
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Alcohol use disorders often occur together with anxiety disorders
column3: especially among youth. When these two occur together
column4: individuals can have worse symptoms and treatment outcomes. This study will enhance the prevention and early intervention between anxiety and hazardous alcohol use by identifying key underlying mechanisms driving their relationship
column5: and optimising interventions which address both conditions simultaneously."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013862^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013862"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Targeting immune resistance mechanisms to enhance anti-tumour immunity in Non-Small Cell Lung Cancer
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Lung cancer remains the leading cause of cancer related death globally. Treatments designed to unleash the immune systemâs brakes (âimmunotherapyâ) have resulted in significantly improved long-term survival in only a minority of patients. Tumour cells evolve to escape the immune system by silencing signals that allow their recognition by immune cells. We will identify means to reactivating these signals could enable immunotherapy to work in these otherwise resistant tumours."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013877^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013877"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Risk factors for and burden of low back pain in elite athletes.
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Despite being in peak physical condition
column3: athletes experience low back pain (LBP) at a higher rate than other members of our community. The reasons for this are not well understood and the advice to "keep active" that is given to non-athletic patients is less appropriate for athletes. This project will recruit and follow 300 elite athletes for one year to identify risk factors for athlete LBP. The project will also measure the cost of LBP in terms of episodes of pain and training time lost."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013894^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013894"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Young people with old knees: The role of matrix metalloproteinase 3 and type 2 collagen C-telopeptide fragments in predicting post traumatic osteoarthritis after anterior cruciate ligament reconstruction
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Anterior cruciate ligament (ACL) injuries are common in young and active people. The development of knee arthritis after ACL injury and ACL surgery is a concern because it can lead to a situation were a young patient has an "old knee". This scenario is a major cause of disability and is very challenging to treat. This research is important in identifying patients at risk of premature arthritis and to facilitate prevention
column3: treatment and better outcomes for this young patient group."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013908^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013908"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Validation and implementation of smartphone-based digital biomarkers in multiple sclerosis to define subclinical progression and treatment failure: the ACTIVE MS study
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Multiple sclerosis (MS) is a leading cause of disability amongst young Australian adults. To date
column3: only 2 effective treatments for progressive MS has been found. Current treatment is limited by the lack of accurate tools to detect disease progression
column4: which leads to inefficient clinical trials for progressive MS. This project aims to establish smartphone-based apps as a tool to monitor disease activity and detect subtle clinical progression
column5: thereby empowering patients in their own care."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013928^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013928"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Comorbid Mental Health and Drug and Alcohol Use Among Sexuality and Gender Diverse Young People in Australia
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"This study aims to fill a gap in current literature around existing rates of comorbid mental ill-health and drug and alcohol use among young sexuality and gender diverse people (aged 14-25). Existing literature has demonstrated that this population have higher rates of mental ill-health and drug and alcohol use compared to their heterosexual and cisgender peers. I will examine the rates and risk and protective factors of comorbidity among this group
column3: using nationally representative datasets."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013946^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013946"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Hypertension with low renin - new insights into prevalence
column2: pathophysiology and management
column3: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"High blood pressure is a major cause of death affecting over 6 million Australians
column4: yet two-thirds of patients have poor control. Many of these patients may have a type of hypertension that will respond well to a cheap and widely available medicine called an aldosterone blocker. We will test this drug against currently recommended hypertension treatments to find out if our approach will improve blood pressure control and the overall health of patients."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013949^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013949"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Maternal and Child Health Nursing: A golden opportunity to integrate screening for reproductive coercion and increase effective contraception use?
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"This research will create and test a short set of questions about behaviours used to control the pregnancy choices of another person. We aim to help health care workers talk to clients about making a safety plan and planning a pregnancy. The questions will be tested in the Victorian Maternal Child Health Service where nurses currently ask about domestic and family violence. Researchers will also review research papers and talk to nurses
column3: their clients and experts to learn about their opinions."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013951^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013951"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Preventing infectious disease and reducing associated harms among people who inject drugs
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"People who inject drugs (PWID) are an understudied population and there are gaps in our understanding of their experience with infectious disease. This project will produce crucial evidence on: 1) vaccination rates and barriers; 2) rates of infection; 3) service utilisation after infection; and 4) effect of drug dependence treatment on infectious disease-related outcomes. These data will inform interventions to prevent and treat infectious disease
column3: improving health outcomes of PWID."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013953^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013953"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The impact of COVID-19 and associated health policies on access to allied healthcare
column2: care quality
column3: and health outcomes in Australian residential aged care facilities
column4: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"This PhD seeks to explore care quality
column5: health outcomes
column6: and allied healthcare delivery in residential aged care facilities pre and during COVID-19. This PhD uses electronic medical record data from a large aged care provider. Findings will be used to inform care practices and policy during future RACF lockdowns which occur regularly for conditions like influenza. The results also address key policy areas in care quality
column7: e.g.
column8: falls

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013961^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013961"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Genomic architecture of skin in the vicinity of previous melanoma in photodamaged and non-photodamaged areas
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"UV damage is a cause of melanoma-associated mutations
column3: but recent work shows that even normal skin is awash with mutations. Why do some sites become melanoma
column4: but not in nearby
column5: equally UV-damaged sites? I will identify genomic aberrations
column6: that are markers of melanoma-prone sites
column7: by assessing skin from UV-damaged sites near melanomas
column8: UV-damaged sites away from melanomas
column9: and sun-protected sites with spatial profiling technology that will enable a molecular map of aberrations across the skin."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013970^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013970"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"High-risk lymphoproliferative malignancies in the era of novel therapies: Infection risk
column2: surveillance and prophylaxis
column3: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Opportunistic infection risk in lymphoma patients is incompletely understood
column4: especially amongst heavily pre-treated patients receiving novel cellular therapies. This project will explore infection epidemiology
column5: prediction and prophylaxis strategies amongst lymphoma patients. Retrospective cohort analysis
column6: immune-profiling
column7: multivariate analysis of infection risk and national audit of prophylaxis strategies will be conducted
column8: informing future infection prevention and treatment strategies."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013981^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013981"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Developing and evaluating an evidence-based training program for improving labour and childbirth care in India.
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Prolonged labour is a major cause of stillbirth and maternal haemorrhage. The WHO Labour Care Guide (LCG) is a labour-monitoring tool which assists nurses
column3: midwives and doctors provide early and effective interventions to prevent these complications. In my PhD
column4: I will develop a LCG training program and evaluate its effects on LCG use within four hospitals in India. By optimizing LCG use
column5: we expect the quality of maternity care and women's childbirth experiences to improve."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013987^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2013987"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Responsible pre-operative Opioid use for Hip and knee ArthropLasTy (OpioidHALT) study
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Opioids are medicines used to manage strong pain
column3: but are associated with significant side effects. Opioids are often prescribed inappropriately for osteoarthritis and
column4: when used before surgery
column5: lead to worse pain and longer hospital stay. We propose an intervention where pharmacists educate patients on pain self-management and help with lowering opioid doses before surgery. This research is projected to save $5 million from safer opioid use and reduced hospital costs."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014022^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014022"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Revolutionising System Reform in Mental Health: Addressing Gaps in the System through Big Data and Data Linkage
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"The current mental health system in Australia is not providing the care to those that need it the most. This program of research aims to understand how the mental health system is failing these individuals though an internationally unique approach of analysing population-level ambulance and healthcare records to provide insights into how to improve and re-develop the system."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014024^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014024"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Identifying and addressing the needs and priorities of patients with genetic kidney disease and their families
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Chronic kidney disease has a genetic cause in 10% of affected adults and up to 70% of children. A diagnosis of genetic kidney disease (GKD) can bring about a complex emotional response
column3: this psychological burden if not addressed leads to frustration
column4: and distress. I aim to describe patient and clinician experiences of genetic testing
column5: and of GKD
column6: determine patient priorities for genetic testing and models of care in GKD
column7: and develop and implement patient resources to improve care in GKD."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014035^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014035"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Personalising Pain Relief for People With Cancer: The Right Opioid For the Right Person at the Right Time
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Cancer pain is common and distressing. There is no scientific method to predict which opioid will work for which person. The same opioid may treat one personâs pain well
column3: but cause confusion
column4: or be ineffective for another. This multi-phase project aims to transform pain management.It will consolidate the evidence
column5: and evaluate the impact and feasibility of using gene testing to personalise opioid prescribing for cancer
column6: so that the right opioid is prescribed to the right person at the right time"^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014036^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014036"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Biomarker profiles in Indigenous Australians with systemic lupus erythematosus
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Lupus is a serious
column3: incurable illness which reduces quality of life and life expectancy. Indigenous Australians have more frequent and severe lupus than the general population
column4: although the reasons for this are unclear. I aim to analyse proteins in the blood of Indigenous and non-Indigenous lupus patients
column5: to determine if there are biochemical differences which explain these disparities. This may help us select better treatments for Indigenous lupus patients in the future."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014037^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014037"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Treatments to expand regulatory T cells and/or deplete autoantibody production in primary membranous nephropathy
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Primary membranous nephropathy (pMN) is a kidney disease caused by antibodies that attack the kidney (autoantibody) and is often difficult to treat. We propose research into treatments in a rat model of pMN that target autoantibody-producing immune cells or promote regulatory immune cells
column3: using manufactured immune cells and protein vaccination. We will also compare the immune cells in humans with pMN and healthy individuals to identify specific immune cells targetable using our new treatments."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014038^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014038"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Towards vaginal microbiota stability: new treatment paradigm for bacterial vaginosis
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Bacterial vaginosis (BV) is very common in reproductive aged women. Current therapies are not very effective. However bacterial vaginosis is linked with poor reproductive health outcomes in women. New therapies are needed. Phages are viruses that attack bacteria
column3: and CPR bacteria are a group of little-known bacteria that parasitise other bacteria. This research will investiage how phages and CPR bacteria affect vaginal health and develop new BV therapies based on phages and CPR bacteria."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014056^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014056"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Using mathematical models to generate evidence to support Australiaâs COVID-19 responses and prepare for future pandemics
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"My PhD will utilise mathematical modelling to generate evidence to support COVID-19 responses in Australia and prepare for future epidemics/pandemics. The main objectives are to address current COVID-19 policy questions (e.g. vaccination strategies)
column3: learn lessons from deep analysis of previous COVID-19 outbreaks in Australia
column4: and produce generalisable and impactful guidelines for future pandemic responses."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014074^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014074"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Economic evaluation of strategies to increase kidney donation and transplantation
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"I will investigate value and harm of changing the way organ donation is managed in Australia using health economic approaches. I will use data from a large trial to look at how quality of life changes over time as people wait for a transplant. By linking health datasets together I will look at whether the transplant program in Australia treats everyone fairly."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014086^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014086"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving Syphilis diagnosis and management in the community
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Syphilis is an important global health problem. Rates of syphilis have climbed dramatically in Australia
column3: with heterosexual populations increasingly affected and rises in congenital syphilis. This research project has three objectives: i) to optimize diagnosis of syphilis in general practice using new testing methods; ii) to design and evaluate clinic systems to improve screening for syphilis; and iii) to improve partner notification using internet based contact tracing."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014100^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014100"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Understanding Cirrhotic Cardiomyopathy
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Liver transplant is the only life-saving option for people with end-stage liver disease. People with liver disease can also have a type of heart failure that can be problematic with liver transplant because of the major stress on the body. This project aims to enrich our understanding of how often
column3: and why this disease happens. We will use a new technique called "metabolomics" to look for specific bloods markers and also follow patients and the changes in their hearts before and after transplant"^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014110^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014110"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Radial artery conduits in coronary artery bypass surgery: the impact of prior instrumentation with a focus on the vascular biology and clinical outcomes.
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Certain patients with severely narrowed coronary arteries may require bypass (open heart) surgery
column3: with the radial artery in the forearm frequently used as a bypass graft. Prior to surgery
column4: this artery is also used to insert wires and plastic tubes which are fed up the arm to the heart to perform a coronary angiogram. This research aims to assess what damage a coronary angiogram does to the radial artery
column5: and whether this impacts on its ability to be used as a coronary artery bypass graft."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014111^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014111"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"An integration of multi-omics and machine learning to stratify patients with lupus nephritis for precision medicine
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"This project will investigate genetic and metabolic changes associated with Lupus Nephritis (LN). I will undertake transitional
column3: genomic and metabolic profiling of patients to assess alterations associated with disease activity in LN. I will then analyse this data using machine learning to stratify patient disease class and generate non- invasive disease markers to predict LN activity and uncover new drug targets. This approach will provide personalised medicine for patients with LN."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014112^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014112"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Cardiovascular Screening in Cancer Patients Treated with Immune Checkpoint Inhibitors
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Patients with cancer treated with immunotherapy are at higher risk of cardiovascular disease. As cancer survival with immunotherapy is improving
column3: it is important to address cardiovascular risk and screening in cancer patients to reduce the burden of cardiovascular disease and improve overall survivorship. We aim to evaluate cardiovascular risk and guide screening policies that could help prevent cardiovascular disease in cancer patients receiving immunotherapy."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014114^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014114"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The role of cytochrome polymorphisms in primaquine metabolism and effects on its activity in radical cure of Plasmodium vivax infection
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Malaria is a mosquito-borne infection that can be life threatening. Globally there were 228 million cases and 405
column3: 000 deaths in 2018. One species
column4: vivax malaria
column5: can cause recurrent infection due to a dormant stage in the liver. The drug primaquine kills this dormant stage. However
column6: recent studies have shown that genetic variations may limit primaquine effectiveness. This research will investigate how genetic variations affect primaquine metabolism and the prevention of recurrent vivax malaria."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014122^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014122"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Informing future recommendations for prevention and treatment of ovarian cancer using population data
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Ovarian cancer is the eighth most commonly diagnosed cancer in females worldwide. Five-year survival remains below 50% and physical and psychological symptoms are common amongst survivors. I aim to assess: 1. Factors associated with ovarian cancer risk to inform prevention strategies 2. Survival
column3: symptom and wellbeing outcomes associated with current care pathways to optimise future treatment 3. Lifestyle and genetic factors associated with survival
column4: symptoms and wellbeing to improve outcomes"^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014140^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014140"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Cardiometabolic
column2: Genetic and Lifestyle Risk Factors for Arrhythmias
column3: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Abnormal heart rhythms are common conditions that cause debilitating symptoms and lead to poorer health outcomes. We have recently begun to appreciate the importance of managing lifestyle and other risk factors in these disorders; however
column4: we still have an incomplete understanding of the role of alcohol consumption
column5: healthy diet
column6: and iron deficiency. This project will inform us of the optimal management of these risk factors
column7: to provide the best care for patients with heart rhythm disorders."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014142^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014142"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Perinatal and early childhood risk and protective factors for paediatric infection
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Infection is the most common reason for children needing healthcare. All children are exposed to viruses and bacteria that can cause them to become ill. However
column3: some children are more likely to become ill or get a more severe illness than other children
column4: and the reasons why are not known. This project looks at whether events or conditions during pregnancy
column5: birth and the early years of life could change how likely children are to get sick
column6: or how severe their illness is."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014147^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014147"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Developing a community-based psychosocial intervention for young people with mental illness
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"The overall aim is to design
column3: develop
column4: deliver
column5: and evaluate a community-based program for youth with serious mental illness. The tangible outcome of this research will be the development of a trauma-informed
column6: community-based mental health program that has been designed by youth
column7: for youth
column8: to effectively meet their unique psychosocial needs. It is intended that the program improves psychosocial functioning
column10: and enhances the life trajectory of these vulnerable youth."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014148^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014148"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Decolonising approaches for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander children with complex health needs exposed to the youth justice system in Australia: Reducing incarceration and recidivism rates
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Urgent research is required to reduce lifelong harm and the over-representation of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander youth who are exposed to police custody and youth detention. A co-designed culturally appropriate diversionary model of care is imperative to identify complex health needs and create alternative pathways
column3: away from detention. Scoping literature reviews and yarning circles with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander youth and their communities will inform this process."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014162^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014162"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Determining health system and public policy elements for successful implementation and sustainability of cervical cancer elimination strategies at a country and regional level
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"The global burden of cervical cancer is significant
column3: however elimination is possible. This PhD aims to support global cervical cancer elimination by determining a best practice approach for member states to achieve optimum implementation of WHO strategies and concurrent health system strengthening. Policy analysis
column4: stakeholder consultation and expert consensus will be used to develop a planning tool for governments to optimise implementation of cervical cancer elimination strategies."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014163^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014163"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Optimising trial processes and generating translational gains: Studies Within A Trial (SWATs) for the MELSELF randomised controlled trial of patient-led melanoma surveillance.
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"With increasing concerns about research waste in clinical trials
column3: there is recognition of the need to improve the design and operation of trials. With that in mind the Studies Within a Trial (SWAT) methodology has been developed to generate evidence to inform the conduct of future trials. My research will evaluate strategies to improve participant recruitment
column4: retention
column5: and intervention adherence within a series of SWATs embedded within a melanoma surveillance host trial."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014165^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014165"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Application of advanced manufacturing technologies to offload diabetes-related foot ulceration
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"People with diabetes can develop wounds on their feet due to high pressures. These wounds cause significant health and personal impacts for those affected and present a high cost to the health system. Current treatments are not always provided and are often not used by patients. This project explores how 3D scanning
column3: computer aided design
column4: and 3D printing could be used to make a more affordable
column5: accessible and personalised treatment that clinicians are more likely to provide and patients use."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014166^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014166"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Development and evaluation of strategies to improve syphilis screening of pregnant women to prevent congenital syphilis
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"This project aims to improve screening for syphilis at a time when increasing numbers of babies are being infected with syphilis. It will have three main aims: to assess the current situation regarding syphilis screening during pregnancy
column3: to implement a new screening policy in pregnancy and to assess the efficacy of the new policy and techniques."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014180^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014180"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving evidence-based practice for comorbid alcohol and other drug and mental health conditions: the role of implementation science and quality improvement toolkits
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Alcohol and other drug (AOD) and mental disorders frequently co-occur
column3: yet there is a lack of evidence-based treatment in AOD services and a lack of studies focusing on reducing this evidence-to-practice gap. This thesis seeks to improve evidence-based practice in AOD services by developing
column4: implementing and evaluating the effectiveness of a quality improvement toolkit that assists services to implement evidence-based guidelines for managing comorbid mental health conditions in AOD settings."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014206^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014206"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Investigating epigenetic regulators of disease and novel epigenetic treatment approaches for imprinting disorders
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Prader-Willi Syndrome (PWS) and Schaaf-Yang syndrome (SYS) are incurable disorders caused by a lack of expression of the paternal copy of particular genes. Patients have normal maternal copies but these are switched off. A potential treatment is to activate the silenced copies by removing the function of proteins that normally repress their expression. Here we will investigate a new potential treatment for PWS/SYS targeting the protein called SMCHD1 that normally switches off these genes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014208^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014208"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Koolungar Urban Moorditj Healthy Skin: Determining the burden of skin disease in urban Aboriginal children and adolescents.
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Skin infections and their complications are very common in remote-living Australian-Aboriginal children
column3: but we do not know if urban Aboriginal children have this same risk. This is despite almost 80% of Australia's Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander population living in regional and metropolitan areas. Working with Aboriginal Elders
column4: we have designed a project to determine how common skin diseases are in urban Aboriginal youth
column5: in order to improve prevention and treatment of skin infections."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014210^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014210"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Defining host immune response and prevention strategies for viral respiratory tract infections in patients with haematological malignancy
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Viruses such as COVID-19 and influenza can lead to severe chest infections in patients with blood cancers. This research project aims to study the immune response to infection by these viruses in patients receiving treatment for blood cancers. This information will help us to improve treatment and vaccination against these viruses. A major aim is to prevent further infection. Results from this project may change current vaccination practice in Australia and lead to further research projects."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014215^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014215"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Enhancing venetoclax and other pro-apoptotic agents to improve outcomes for patients with haematological malignancies
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Blood cancers kill &gt;4
column3: 500 Australians per year. A new drug
column4: venetoclax
column5: has significantly improved outcomes for these patients
column6: but relapses frequently occur. This PhD will analyse cancer cells at the single cell level to identify and specifically target the resistant populations that cause relapse. We will study how to undermine the energy metabolism of cancer cells
column7: which may synergise with venetoclax. These projects strive to develop new treatments to improve patient care and achieve cures."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014234^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014234"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Dissecting the challenge of AML
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Acute myeloid leukaemia (AML) is a life-threatening blood cancer that is difficult to treat. Recently
column3: several new âtargeted therapyâ drugs have been developed
column4: which work by blocking specific changes in cancer cells that help them survive and grow. Unfortunately
column5: resistance to treatment commonly emerges. This project aims to understand how resistance can arise and how they affect responsiveness to different drugs. This information will help us develop better treatments for patients with AML."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014244^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014244"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Ventricular arrhythmia mechanisms and therapies
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Heart disease is the leading cause of death in Australia
column3: with heart rhythm disorders being a major cause for debilitating symptoms and sudden cardiac death. Our understanding of heart rhythm disorders is incomplete. My aim is to study the mechanisms and therapies of heart rhythm disorders
column4: including medications and procedural technologies
column5: using advanced techniques and diagnostic tools to treat and potentially cure heart rhythm disorders
column6: improve quality of life &amp; prevent sudden cardiac death."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014245^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014245"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Untangling Neuroinflammation's Role in Alzheimer's Disease Development (UNRAVEL)
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"My PhD will lead to new understandings around the associations between tau homeostasis
column3: neuroinflammation
column4: and neurodegeneration
column5: as well as identifying clinically useful biomarkers to support the diagnosis
column6: prognosis and monitoring of patients with AD. My work will also shed light on the effects of SAMe on neuroinflammatory pathways
column7: providing further information on the activity of this potential therapeutic
column8: as well as identifying novel potential neuroinflammatory therapeutic targets."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014256^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014256"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A randomised controlled human challenge trial to evaluate Strep A vaccine efficacy
column2: safety
column3: and immunogenicity
column4: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"In human challenge models
column5: healthy volunteers are given a carefully monitored infection to learn how diseases work and how to stop them. In this project
column6: a new Australian strep throat human model will be used to test a vaccine against Strep A
column7: which affects &gt;750 million and kills &gt;500

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014258^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014258"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Improving care and outcomes for vulnerable patients with chronic kidney disease â the young and the elderly
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"This study aims to examine patient-centered interventions for vulnerable populations with chronic kidney disease that assist with managing their condition
column3: accessing care to ultimately improve healthcare outcomes. Specifically the study will assess the impact of personalised care plans that integrates patient priorities to improve the quality of life and reduce the burden of disease among children and older frail people with CKD and their families; and engaging patients in translatable research."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014261^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014261"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Novel technologies and strategies to identify arrhythmogenic substrate and triggers for sudden cardiac death
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"The most common cause of sudden cardiac death is ventricular arrhythmias (VAs) - rapid heart rhythms can cause the heart to stop beating. Catheter ablation (CA)
column3: where regions of the heart from which these rhythms arise (scar) are burned can treat VA however requires accurate identification scar with invasive maps. Novel technologies including machine learning
column4: 3D echocardiography and ECG imaging allow for non-invasive characterisation. This project aims to further validate these technologies."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014262^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014262"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Exceptional cognition in old age and interactions with other aspects of successful ageing
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Research on adults who function successfully at older ages could provide insights into what determines wellbeing in old age
column3: how dementia could be prevented and what services might be required for older adults. This research will examine not just memory and other cognitive processes but also physical function and social connectedness to see how these aspects of functioning interact in successful ageing."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014266^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014266"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Evaluating the use of an open access self-collection cervical screening pathway: The solution to declining participation and to long standing inequities?
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Australiaâs renewed National Cervical Screening Program enabled an alternative self-collection pathway for women who were under-screened. Data collected from early adopters indicates it is highly acceptable
column3: however
column4: significant implementation issues with the strict eligibility criteria and limited promotion have led to a low uptake of the pathway. This research will evaluate the use of open access to self-collection as a solution to addressing longstanding inequities in Australiaâs program."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014285^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014285"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A Cognitive Ageing Risk Evaluation (CARE) Tool to Support Clinical Diagnosis of Dementia for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Dementia among Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples is much greater than the general Australian population. There is need to better understand the risk factors that account for this and the role of brain imaging and blood tests in assessment of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples vulnerable to cognitive decline. This research will look at the risk factors and blood markers to improve diagnosis
column3: management and support for patients and families affected."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014292^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014292"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The Science of Cold Snare Polypectomy
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Colorectal cancer (CRC) was the third most commonly diagnosed cancer in Australia in 2017 with an estimated incidence rate of 67 per 100
column3: 000. Screening by colonoscopy can lead to a reduced cancer incidence as well as mortality through early detection of cancer and pre-cancerous lesions. Endoscopy training is heuristic and imperfect. Identifying risk factors for incomplete polypectomy and quantifying adequate resection margin will help frame world polypectomy guidelines."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014294^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014294"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"How does methamphetamine use
column2: mental health and treatment interventions affect one another?
column3: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Within Australia
column4: an increasing proportion of people are using crystalline methamphetamine
column5: or ice. Using amphetamines has been linked to various harms and an increased risk of comorbid mental health disorders. However
column6: exploring the link between comorbid mental health and treatment outcomes has been limited. The proposed PhD aims to explore this link further through linking multiple cohorts of people dependent on methamphetamine as well as methamphetamine-related hospital presentations."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014320^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014320"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Modulation of the gut microbiome and mucosal immune response in IBD
column2: Postgraduate Scholarships"^"Inflammatory bowel disease (IBD) is an incurable condition with significant morbidity and mortality. Australia has one of the highest prevalence rates in the world
column3: costing $3.1 billion dollars annually. The gut microbiome appears to be a key player in the onset and trajectory of IBD. Over the course of a 4 year PhD
column4: we aim to evaluate how the gut microbiome affects the gut immune system and how this can be utilised to develop and target drug therapy to better control and potentially cure IBD."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008433^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2008433"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Innovative point-of-care diagnostics and environmental surveillance tools for the elimination of Asian schistosomiasis
column2: International Collaborations"^"Accurate and rapid diagnostics are one of the key cornerstones for control and elimination of schistosomiasis in Asia. This cooperative research project aims to develop and trial rapid
column3: cost-effective
column4: field-friendly point-of-care (POC) diagnostics and environmental DNA (eDNA) detection tests for Asian schistosomiasis. Integrating the POCs and eDNA detection to the current schistosomiasis control programs within Asia and beyond can lead control policy and assess elimination goals.</field><field id="e-Asia Project Title">Innovative point-of-care diagnostics and environmental surveillance tools for the elimination of Asian schistosomiasis"^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009545^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009545"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Ending HIV transmission by Optimizing Pre-exposure prophylaxis in East Asia (HOPE)
column2: International Collaborations"^"This cooperative research project aims to bring together regional experts to co-design strategies with affected communities in Australia
column3: Thailand and Philippines to optimize adherence to pre-exposure prophylaxis (PrEP) for HIV. Activities include networking and capacity building through cross-country
column4: multidisciplinary workshops and conferences; and implementing interventions informed by innovative methods (crowdsourcing
column5: discrete choice experiments) to optimize adherence among PrEP users.</field><field id="e-Asia Project Title">Ending HIV transmission by Optimizing Pre-exposure prophylaxis in East Asia (HOPE)"^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009656^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009656"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Vector sero-surveillance tools to accelerate malaria elimination
column2: International Collaborations"^"Measuring antibody responses to mosquito salivary proteins in human sera may be a practical
column3: highly sensitive alternative approach to estimate human biting rates and exposure to vector-borne diseases such as malaria. We will measure these salivary antibodies in a human biting challenge trial where volunteers are repeatedly bitten by mosquitoes to define antibody thresholds which predict biting rates. Furthermore
column4: we will validate this sero-surveillance tool in field trials of vector control."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009816^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2009816"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Targeting MYCN/NCYM for cancer therapy
column2: International Collaborations"^"Primary liver cancer is a common cause of death from cancer in adults. Hepatocellular carcinoma represents approximately 90% of all cases of primary liver cancer. Cancer is the most common cause of death from diseases in children. Neuroblastoma is the most common solid tumour in early childhood. In this project
column3: we will identify a novel therapeutic strategy targeting hepatocellular carcinoma and neuroblastoma for clinical translation."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014513^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014513"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"COgNiTive propagation in pRodrOmaL Parkinsonâs disease: CONTROL-PD
column2: International Collaborations"^"It has long been felt that not all patients with Parkinsonâs disease are affected by the same pattern of cell death
column3: which results in differences in their presentation
column4: progression and response to treatment. This program will link international research teams who have can perform detailed assessments not only patients with the condition but also in the prodromal phases of disease to help better understand these differences and improve outcomes."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014629^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014629"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Effects of early-Stress On Lipid mediators and Inflammation for early Detection of neurodegeneration (SOLID)
column2: International Collaborations"^"The next frontier in Alzheimerâs Disease (AD) research is to find easily measurable biomarkers for neurodegeneration and cognitive dysfunction. Our translational project will leverage data and samples from 4 established human cohorts and 10+ rodent models. We will identify i) early biomarkers predictive of neurodegeneration and cognitive dysfunction ii) the causal role of early-life adversity on predisposition to AD and iii) an intervention strategy for alleviating these effects."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014651^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014651"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"Leveraging medical records to identify patients at risk of neurodegenerative disease
column2: International Collaborations"^"Neurodegenerative diseases represent one of the main public health issues in our western societies and one of the greatest challenges in drug development. Therapeutic intervention for these disease works best with early intervention
column3: ideally at pre-symptomatic stages. LeMeReND proposes to use electronic health records (EHR) to identify biomedical risk factors through studying previous diagnoses (pre-clinical comorbidities)
column4: drug prescription
column5: clinical care usage
column6: and biological test results."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014745^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014745"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"A randomised CONtrolled trial of Tailored Acceptance and Commitment Therapy for older people with treatment resistant Generalised Anxiety Disorder (CONTACT-GAD)
column2: International Collaborations"^"Generalised anxiety disorder (GAD) is one of the most common mental disorders in later life. It is characterised by excessive and uncontrollable worry that is often chronic and associated with poorer quality of life
column3: increased disability and greater use of medication and health services. Current treatments for GAD are not always well tolerated in this population. Acceptance and Commitment therapy (ACT) is a promising psychological therapy. This clinical trial will compare ACT to usual care."^""^""^""^

column1: https://demo.researchdata.ardc.edu.au/view?key=http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014792^"http://purl.org/au-research/grants/nhmrc/2014792"^"activity"^"www.nhmrc.gov.au/grants/research-funding-statistics-and-data"^"grant"^""^""^"The neoGASTRIC trial: Avoiding routine gastric residual volume measurement in neonatal critical care
column2: a multi-centre
column3: randomised controlled trial
column4: International Collaborations"^"Before feeding preterm babies
column5: nurses aspirate the contents of the stomach from the feeding tube to assess the âresidual volumeâ of feed
column6: to determine the feeding plan. It is not clear if this is helpful (by detecting gut issues early)
column7: or harmful (by unnecessarily delaying feeding). In this trial
column8: half of included infants will have gastric residual volumes routinely measured
column9: and half will not. This will show which approach is best
column10: for establishing feeding and avoiding any harm."^""^""^""^
